PAGE: ABOUT US
URL: https://www.mwam.com/about-us/
========================================

Our Story About Us
Our Story
Marshall Wace is a leading provider of alternative investment solutions
Operating as a single team across the globe, we are dedicated to creating long-term relationships with our clients built on trust and integrity. We define our culture as one of continuous innovation and a quest for improvement. We instinctively strive to do things differently, with fresh thinking that we believe enables us to create proprietary value and maximise the benefits to our clients.
25+ years
INNOVATING AS WE SEEK TO MAXIMISE THE RISK-ADJUSTED RETURNS FOR OUR CLIENTS
20+ years
EXPERIENCE IN GROUND-BREAKING QUANTITATIVE AND SYSTEMATIC MODEL DEVELOPMENT
Our Strategies
Our investment approach
We manage quantitative, systematic and fundamental strategies, specialising predominantly in long/short equity. Our strategies are implemented globally, leveraging proprietary systems and processes.
Technology and data have been at the core of our business for more than two decades. In 2002, we launched MW TOPS, the world’s first ‘Alpha Capture’ application. Today, we continue to foster an environment focused on innovation and the pursuit of excellence.
Our Strategies
Our investment approach
We manage quantitative, systematic and fundamental strategies, specialising predominantly in long/short equity. Our strategies are implemented globally, leveraging proprietary systems and processes.
Technology and data have been at the core of our business for more than two decades. In 2002, we launched MW TOPS, the world’s first ‘Alpha Capture’ application. Today, we continue to foster an environment focused on innovation and the pursuit of excellence.
Our Partnerships
KKR Partnership
In September 2015, KKR & Co. Inc. (“KKR”) entered into a definitive agreement with Marshall Wace to form a long-term strategic partnership. Under the terms of the agreement, KKR initially acquired an interest in Marshall Wace through a combination of cash and stock with the right to grow KKR’s ownership interest over time, up to 39.9%. KKR has market leadership positions in Private Equity and Credit markets, which complement Marshall Wace’s market leadership position in Equity Long/Short, liquid alternative products.
The strategic partnership is based on a shared vision of how financial markets are changing and how best to serve clients’ evolving investment requirements, bringing together strong traditions of investment expertise, innovation, entrepreneurship, and cultural alignment.
OUR TEAMS
Our people are our greatest asset, and we invest heavily in them
We value free-thinkers who are committed and ambitious. We hold our staff to the highest standards and we care deeply about each of them, focussing on their personal and professional development.
View Our Teams

PAGE: TEAMS
URL: https://www.mwam.com/teams/
========================================

Our People Teams
Our People
We work together to make great things happen
We have a drive for innovation, and everyone who works here is connected by our motto – what brings us together sets us apart.
We welcome new ideas, accept differing opinions and embrace new ways of seeing the world. Take a look at the spectrum of talent and specialities across our teams. If you think you can bring a fresh perspective, get in touch today.

========================================
PAGE: VALUES & CULTURE
URL: https://www.mwam.com/values-and-culture/
========================================

Entrepreneurialism
We expect people to develop and execute new initiatives
Our industry is demanding and competitive. We look for our employees to act like entrepreneurs by driving change, challenging consensus and thinking commercially. It is then, crucially important to execute and deliver on these initiatives.
Innovation
We thrive on new ideas and differentiated opinions
We place great importance on encouraging our people to be creative, to deliver new ideas, present new concepts and develop new solutions to drive our business forward.
Clients First
Clients are our top priority
Everything we do centres around our goal to deliver successful outcomes for our investors. We combine our investment strategies with high-performance habits to continuously seek alpha creation.
One Team
We believe in the power of our team
Our people work together to make extraordinary things happen. We share our ideas, skills and knowledge so that great ideas can flourish. Everyone has a role to play and every role matters.
Complete Integrity
We act with integrity in everything we do
We are committed to acting with integrity, accountability and fairness in everything we do. We have a robust moral and ethical code that's applied rigorously across all areas of our business.
A Force for Good
We are committed to social responsibility
Individually and collectively, we look for opportunities to contribute to society through charitable and support initiatives. We wish to set ourselves ambitious, measurable and data driven corporate responsibility targets.

========================================
PAGE: RELENTLESS INNOVATION IN THE PURSUIT OF PERFORMANCE
URL: https://www.mwam.com/technology/
========================================

Our Technology Relentless innovation in the pursuit of performance
Our Technology
A Hunger to Do More
As a firm, we have a hunger to do more, chasing innovation and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
Technological innovation has long been the cornerstone of our business. We continuously invest in our systems, data, infrastructure and people in our efforts to maximise the alpha we deliver for our clients.
We strive to stay at the forefront of advancements in technology and view this as a key competitive advantage. Our staff are constantly seeking new ways to automate and streamline complex processes using a diverse mix of cutting-edge tools. Every member of our staff is expected to seek out new opportunities and push for advancements to our platform.
Join Us
Technology Graduate Programme
Discover our exciting graduate programme in London, Singapore and New York.
Learn More
Technology Internship Programme
Discover our exciting internship programme in London, Singapore, New York and Hong Kong.
Learn More

PAGE: FUNDAMENTAL ANALYST
URL: https://www.mwam.com/join-us/fundamental-analyst/
========================================

Join our team Fundamental Analyst
Join Our Team
Accelerate Your Career
We have designed a two-year programme for talented young professionals to join the Fundamental Investment teams at Marshall Wace. The aim of the program is to further develop analytical skills and gain investment experience. We are looking for exceptional talent with the intention that these Analysts will join one of our Fundamental Investment teams full time at the end of the program.
Asset management is competitive and we are looking for individuals who can excel, who are determined, who can innovate and be entrepreneurs to generate new ideas as well as challenge consensus and existing norms.
All successful applicants will be placed into a team for the full duration of the programme so they may develop an in-depth understanding of the specific team’s investment approach. There may also be flexibility for Analysts to rotate into a second investment team on a case-by-case basis.
Please note we are not currently hiring for this position. Due to the high amount of interest that we receive for this programme when we do open, we do not accept direct applications for this role. Instead, we rely on dedicated agency partners who will source and screen the best candidates for us based on the team requirements at the time. Their role is to proactively headhunt those who will be most suitable for the scheme.

PAGE: QUANTITATIVE ASSOCIATE PROGRAMME
URL: https://www.mwam.com/quantitative-associate-programme/
========================================

Join Us Quantitative Associate Programme
Go looking for change
We are looking for driven and avidly inquisitive individuals with a research scientist mindset, ready to challenge ideas and push through new solutions.
You’ll be embedded into one of the Systematic Investment teams where, from day one, you’ll actively contribute to the development of our quantitative strategies.
Applications are now closed for 2026. We will re-open in September 2026 for the 2027 programme.
About the programme
You will be working in a position designed for high-calibre, highly numerate individuals within our quantitative teams. We value free thinkers, and we have created a fast-paced and meritocratic environment where you will be encouraged to apply your own initiative and challenge conventional wisdom. You will be delivering on the research agenda, in addition to back testing/researching forecasts of asset returns on horizons of hours to years.
We all share a tireless drive for innovation and participants tend to be one of the top students at their university. Previous associates are now involved in creating and optimising our signature systematic trading models.
As a member of our Quantitative Associate Programme you will be part of a select cohort receiving on the job training from experienced colleagues who have a matchless record of helping high performing individuals reach their true potential.
About the programme
You will be working in a position designed for high-calibre, highly numerate individuals within our quantitative teams. We value free thinkers, and we have created a fast-paced and meritocratic environment where you will be encouraged to apply your own initiative and challenge conventional wisdom. You will be delivering on the research agenda, in addition to back testing/researching forecasts of asset returns on horizons of hours to years.
We all share a tireless drive for innovation and participants tend to be one of the top students at their university. Previous associates are now involved in creating and optimising our signature systematic trading models.
As a member of our Quantitative Associate Programme you will be part of a select cohort receiving on the job training from experienced colleagues who have a matchless record of helping high performing individuals reach their true potential.
Programme Benefits
Alongside Marshall Wace’s employee benefits programme, Quantitative Associates will experience:
A collaborative and open working environment, with a significant common codebase shared across Quant teams
The opportunity to work on a wide range of projects and problems, and to develop your own research interests and ideas
Extensive in-house knowledge sharing, including a fortnightly internal talk series, and support for additional learning opportunities if desired. Every member of the team also has an allowance to spend on external courses and training
A highly-regarded personal development programme throughout your first 18 months
Access to cutting-edge technology and highly skilled support teams providing an extensive toolkit to help you focus on your work, whether it be alpha research, portfolio construction, etc.
Candidate Qualities
Academic achievement: For the Quantitative Associate role, we require applicants to have achieved a PhD or master’s degree as a minimum. We also encourage applications from candidates with 2-3 years of relevant industry experience.
Strong numeracy: While we are flexible on your degree discipline, we do expect candidates to be highly numerate.
Create value: Our associates need to think critically about a range of strategic issues impacting our business.
“Shoot for the moon” ambition: We want people who think differently, love devising strategies and are focussed on optimal outcomes.
Lead the way: You need to bring innovation at all levels, be tenacious and never settle for the status quo.
Agile minds: You need to show proven ability to move seamlessly between projects, often working on multiple and diverse tasks at the same time.
Team player: You must also be able to work effectively in a team, helping the group to deliver efficient and superior solutions.

PAGE: GRADUATES
URL: https://www.mwam.com/join-us/graduates/
========================================

Join our team Graduates
Join Our Team
Accelerate Your Career
Do you imagine yourself thriving in a tech-driven, diverse environment where your voice truly matters?
Do you aspire to work on real-world projects that add tangible value to a business?
We offer a range of meticulously designed graduate and associate programs that provide early talent with invaluable industry experience. Whether you join our Technology team to develop innovative tools and systems, become part of the Quant Associate program to explore large datasets for alpha, or align with our Business Operations Graduate Scheme to support essential business functions like Operations and Fund Accounting, we have a path for you.
No matter which program you choose, our recruitment process is tailored to identify individuals who share our passion, curiosity, and drive. Expect technical assessments and interviews with our team members, customized to fit the specific role. Detailed information about each process will be provided as you progress, and you can explore more on the relevant pages below.
Through our graduate and associate schemes, you’ll gain deep insights into how Marshall Wace operates and the critical roles each team plays. You’ll not only learn on the job by contributing to meaningful projects but also participate in our Development program, designed to help new joiners enhance and expand their skills.
Join us and start your journey towards a fulfilling career.
Technology Graduate Programme
Discover our exciting graduate programme in London, New York and Singapore.
Learn more about our programme.
Business Operations Graduate Programme
Find out more about our Business Operations graduate programme in London.
Learn more about our programme.
Quantitative Associate Programme
Find out more about our Quantitative Associate programme in London.
Learn more about our programme.

URL: https://www.mwam.com/join-us/internships/
========================================

Join Our Team Internships
Join Our Team
Accelerate Your Career
Can you see yourself in a fast paced environment, working on projects with business impact?
At Marshall Wace, we annually offer a range of internship programmes across various teams. Our internships are meticulously structured to provide you with a practical experience of our work environment, with the aim of enhancing your skills during your tenure with us.
Which teams are hiring varies annually but, when a new internship becomes available, it will be posted below.
We value an environment that is centred around cognitive diversity so all students, regardless of level or areas of study, are encouraged to apply.
Technology Internship Programme
Find out more about our Technology Internship available in London, New York, Singapore and Hong Kong.
Find out more about our programme.

We are innovators. engineers. technologists. mathematicians. thinkers. scientists. tinkerers. strategists. developers. physicists. analysts. statisticians.
HRT is first and foremost a math and technology company. We are engineers and researchers working as one team to solve difficult problems, and trading millions of shares a day on the world’s financial markets.
Join Our Team
What We Do
Hudson River Trading is a multi-asset class quantitative trading firm that provides liquidity on global markets and directly to our clients. We have built one of the world’s most advanced computing environments for research and development, modeling, and risk management, and are at the forefront of technical innovation for financial markets everywhere. We are thoughtful market leaders, committed to the health and longevity of global markets.
Our people are our greatest investment. Here, you can make an immediate and tangible impact.
↳ See Open Positions
Think

Trust
Idea sharing and collaboration is built on trust, respect, and hard work.
Tinker
The most interesting people have interesting hobbies. Tinkerers, unite.
Trade
We’re passionate about the markets and their near infinite mathematical relationships.
Our Philosophy
Our internal code of ethics far exceeds the expectations of the regulatory environment in which we operate. We are conscientious market participants advocating for fair and transparent markets for everyone. This philosophy influences every aspect of our research and the way we operate.
Meet Our Team
Our presence at the forefront of market innovation is powered by our global community. Meet some of the engineers, mathematicians, and scientists building the future of trading.

URL: https://www.hudsonrivertrading.com/about

Who we are.
At HRT we are mathematicians, computer scientists, statisticians, physicists and engineers. We research and develop automated trading algorithms using advanced mathematical techniques.
Life at HRT
HRT’s History
Past
Past
HRT’s founding partners graduated from Harvard and MIT with degrees in computer science and mathematics, and founded HRT in 2002. Armed with programming skills and sharp quantitative minds, the founders hypothesized that by applying a fresh take to trading stocks, one that truly leverages the power of technology, they could meaningfully impact a world still dominated by manual operators. Very quickly, their algorithms saw success in the markets and HRT grew from their origins in US equities to a global, multi-asset class trading firm.
Present
Present
Today HRT employs over a thousand brilliant minds from a variety of mathematical, scientific, technical, and business disciplines. We trade on nearly all of the world’s electronic markets, and are a leading voice for fair and open markets. HRT’s comment letters can be found here.
Future
Future
Join Us
As we grow, HRT continues to build its future on a foundation of collaboration and openness. We leverage the infinite possibilities our culture of sharing creates to explore new ways of trading. We are committed to pushing the industry forward, from contributing open source code, to bringing our expertise to blockchain technology. For more information on our open roles, please visit our careers page here.
Future
Future
Trade With Us
HRT launched our Single Dealer Platform (SDP) in the US and Systematic Internaliser (SI) in Europe in 2018, and Client Market Making in 2022. Learn more about trading with us here.

Whether it’s some football office banter, taking part in annual athletic events, or enjoying lunch together, these offices know how to bond.

Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging.
Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging.
Our goal is to build a diverse workplace where employees from all backgrounds and identities feel empowered to do their best work and build the future of trading — together.
How HRT Supports our Global Employees
At HRT, we are dedicated to building an environment that meets the dynamic needs of our employees. We believe the best way to foster inclusivity is to listen, reflect, and be curious. Here are some of the ways we cultivate a culture where everyone feels valued and empowered:
Employee-informed decision making
Formalized opportunities for honest feedback that directly informs future policy, Employee Resource Groups, and a dedicated DEIB Council to support employee-informed strategies and initiatives.
Ongoing Growth Opportunities
A wide scope of learning & development programming, and impactful guest speakers to offer additional perspectives and enhance our shared knowledge.
Building strong communities
Inclusive and accessible work environment, shared meals and events in the office, and a company-wide stipend for out of office gatherings.
Empowering inclusive leaders
Targeted management and leadership training around inclusive practices, and a DEIB mentorship program.
Meet Our Employee Resource Groups
We are proud to support our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) celebrating diverse voices and experiences across HRT. ERGs create space for employees to share resources, build networks of support, and establish community.

Supporting theFuture of Tech
Addressing barriers for historically-excluded groups within tech and finance is critical to building an equitable future in our industry. We are proud to partner with organizations that support opportunities for everyone in STEM careers. Interested in partnering with us? Reach out to our team.
↳ Contact Us
BEAM
-
BEAM’s (Bridge to Enter Advanced Mathematics) mission is to help students from low-income and historically marginalized communities find a tangible pathway to becoming scientists, mathematicians, engineers, and programmers.
iD Tech
-
iD Tech aims to provide children and teens with high-quality, engaging STEM education through live learning and mentorship from experienced instructors. iD Tech converts real-world interests into lasting STEM careers through a curriculum developed in partnership with professors from top universities and tech entrepreneurs.
Employee Benefits
We are committed to building an environment where all of our employees have the resources they need to grow professionally and contribute to our shared success.

Featured Roles
Algorithm Developer
About The Role
Algo Developers are responsible for building and maintaining the models that drive our trading. A typical day involves applying rigorous statistical analysis to vast quantities of market and financial data to produce predictive trading models. You will run models live on our high-performance trading infrastructure, and analyze their daily performance to maintain ongoing profitability. Working in close collaboration with fellow algo developers and core developers, you will research, develop, and test novel order execution and model training methods to increase trading efficiency.
Am I right for this role?
We’re on the lookout for experienced mathematicians, computer scientists, statisticians, physicists and data scientists.
↳ Explore Job Openings
How an Algorithm Developer Navigates Dynamic Markets
Watch Now →
Amy’s Journey as a Software Engineer at HRT
Watch Now →
Software Engineer
About The Role
As a Software Engineer on HRT’s Core Development team, you will step into an incredible learning opportunity; HRT’s distributed system is on the Pareto frontier of latency and throughput. You’ll develop deep knowledge of C++, OS internals, CPU architecture, and networking hardware and protocols. And you will be surrounded by amazing developers who are honing their skills every day. You’ll be amazed at what you accomplish.
Am I right for this role?
We’re on the lookout for experienced coders, developers, and low level software engineers with experience in Python and C++.
↳ Explore Job Openings
Algo Software Engineer
About The Role
Algo Software Engineers (AEs) are programmers that work hand-in-hand with Algo Developers (ADs). As focus on the software that powers trading and research, and tend to be the type of engineers who thrive on constant interaction and discussion.
Hearing how their most recently-deployed system allowed for whole new types of research would make their week. AEs are engineers who don’t mind juggling a few projects at once and have a varied portfolio of projects, from long-term ambitious new systems to fire-fighting live issues.
Am I right for this role?

Core Values
Automation & Efficiency
We are disciples of automation and efficiency, trading millions of times a day in markets around the globe. At its core, HRT is a small tech company with a big impact.
Collaboration
Collaboration sets HRT apart within our industry. We count among us many brilliant minds, but we’ve learned that the best ideas are born in a shared research and development environment.
Code of Ethics
Our internal code of ethics far exceeds the expectations of the regulatory environment in which we operate. We are conscientious market participants advocating for fair and transparent markets for everyone. This philosophy influences every aspect of our research.
Diversity & Inclusion
At HRT, we celebrate Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging. Our culture is a reflection of the individuals – across race, gender identity and expression, age, religion and worship practices, education status, nationality, and identity – who bring their varied perspectives to work.
Make it Better
Both as individuals and as a company we are tenacious. We are insatiable innovators looking to improve every aspect of our business. We don’t settle until we make it better.
Togetherness
HRT is a community of friends and colleagues. Whether we are sharing a meal or competing over a game of ping pong, HRT embraces a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Financial Wellbeing
Health Coverage
Nothing is more important to us than employee health. At HRT, you can expect company-paid (no premiums!) medical and dental coverage across our global offices. We also offer HRT-funded Health Savings Accounts, uncapped sick days, affordable vision insurance, flexible spending accounts, and Modern Health memberships, which provide access to appointments with therapists and coaches for employees and their dependents at no cost.
Family Time
Supporting our employees also means supporting the people that they love. We offer comprehensive parental leave and family planning benefits to help HRTers prioritize family. US employees can access family planning support through Progyny, including egg freezing, fertility treatments, adoption and surrogacy benefits. Caregiver support, including back-up child care, is available through our partnership with Vivvi. We also host plenty of family-friendly events including kids' day, family nights, and company-wide trips.
Meals & Snacks
We take food very seriously. HRTers enjoy complimentary breakfasts and lunches, along with a wide selection of healthy snacks. Need a caffeine boost? Our coffee bar awaits. And for moments of relaxation, a well-stocked beer and wine fridge.
Inclusive & Accessible Environment
We offer gender-affirming health coverage (region-dependent), gender-neutral bathrooms in many of our offices, and support for HRTers who are transitioning at work. Private wellness rooms are available for meditation, prayer, lactation, or as a private space to attend a virtual appointment. We’re always looking for ways to remove barriers and empower employees of all abilities — if there’s a way we can make it easier for individuals to do their best work, we’re here for it.
Togetherness
Our social calendar includes regular outings like pottery, painting, pizza making, team dinners/happy hours, and an annual volleyball tournament. We take regular team retreats and company-wide trips to connect with each other (families included!) In-office, you can find us unwinding at the end of a long day with video games, happy hours, snack drops, wine/tea club, poker, or table tennis!
Time Off
We believe recharging is important, and time off is encouraged. Employees receive generous paid vacation along with personal days, market holidays, and company-wide trips.
Fitness
Enjoy an on-site cardio and weight room in NYC, complete with sweeping views that will make going to the gym even easier. And for those in our other offices, we've got you covered with a fitness reimbursement.
Comfort
Come as you are! Our dress code is whatever makes you feel comfortable, at ease, and able to do your best work — whether that be your favorite pair of sweatpants or runway best.
Hybrid Work
We recognize that different work carries different in-office needs: some teams require round-the-clock coverage or hands-on maintenance, while others operate across different continents and time zones. While the majority of teams adopt a fairly even split between in-office and remote work, many choose to come in every day.
Professional Development
Learning at HRT never stops. We offer employees reimbursement for career development courses, in-house professional learning & development opportunities, and a vibrant intellectual culture that presents daily opportunities to learn something new.
Financial Wellbeing
In addition to competitive compensation, we offer generous 401k matching to all full-time US employees, pension matching in our EU locations, and CPF contributions for employees in Singapore. Moving to a new city to start your career at HRT? Relocation assistance is available to support your move.
Our Offices
With offices from New York to Singapore, our reach extends to more than 200 markets worldwide. With a strong presence in six countries, our global teams enable us to trade thousands of financial products quickly and efficiently.

FAQs
K
L
Do I need experience in financial markets to apply?
Nope! In fact, the majority of HRTers join us with no previous finance experience. You’ll have a chance to learn on the job and through our training program.
K
L
What programming languages are used in HRT interviews?
For Algorithm Developers, you will be able to choose between C++ and Python. For Software Engineering, you’ll indicate a preference for interviewing with either C++ or Python at the application stage.
K
L
Can I apply for more than one job at the same time?
Please only apply to one job posting. You will have the opportunity to indicate if you are interested in other offices or roles in the application questions.
K
L
What perks are available to interns?
Interns enjoy fully-paid housing, travel allowances, office amenities like an on-site gym and game room, chef-prepared breakfast and lunch, dinner stipends, and hands-on professional development opportunities.
But the internship experience expands far beyond the walls of our office — we want our interns to truly get to know their homes for the summer! Enjoy a vibrant social calendar of unforgettable events, from sporting events to food tours to live theater.
K
L
What’s the difference between an Algorithm Engineer and an Algorithm Developer?
At a high level, Algorithm Engineers are responsible for making the Algo team’s research tools and trading platform powerful, flexible, fast, and easy to use. In order to do this, AEs and SWEs work closely with Algo Developers to understand their needs.
Algorithm Developers build and maintain the models that drive our trading, working hand in hand with Algo Engineers to help test and deploy their strategies. Algorithm Developers rely on a mix of quantitative (math, stats, data analysis) and technical (C++/Python programming) skills in researching, backtesting, and monitoring new strategies.
Check out job descriptions and our YouTube channel for more details on role specifics!
K
L
What is your WFH policy?
Our internship is fully in-person to ensure interns take full advantage of opportunities to connect with HRTers and embed themselves in HRT’s culture.
Full-time roles follow a hybrid model that varies by team.
K
L
What happens after I submit my application? When will I hear back?
Our team will review your application and reach out via email about any next steps. Given the high volume of applicants, please allow up to 2 weeks for your application to be reviewed.
K
L
What does the interview process look like?
Technical interviews at HRT usually consist of a coding test, 1-2 technical phone screens, and a virtual multi-round final interview. Interview length and topics can vary depending on the role. Please review the job descriptions to see required skills for the role you are interested in!
K
L
What are the dates of the HRT internship programs?
Our summer internships run from late-May to mid-August. Our Winternship is a condensed program which takes place in January.

Who we are.
At HRT we are mathematicians, computer scientists, statisticians, physicists and engineers. We research and develop automated trading algorithms using advanced mathematical techniques.
Life at HRT
HRT’s History
Past
Past
HRT’s founding partners graduated from Harvard and MIT with degrees in computer science and mathematics, and founded HRT in 2002. Armed with programming skills and sharp quantitative minds, the founders hypothesized that by applying a fresh take to trading stocks, one that truly leverages the power of technology, they could meaningfully impact a world still dominated by manual operators. Very quickly, their algorithms saw success in the markets and HRT grew from their origins in US equities to a global, multi-asset class trading firm.
Present
Present
Today HRT employs over a thousand brilliant minds from a variety of mathematical, scientific, technical, and business disciplines. We trade on nearly all of the world’s electronic markets, and are a leading voice for fair and open markets. HRT’s comment letters can be found here.

Join Us
As we grow, HRT continues to build its future on a foundation of collaboration and openness. We leverage the infinite possibilities our culture of sharing creates to explore new ways of trading. We are committed to pushing the industry forward, from contributing open source code, to bringing our expertise to blockchain technology. Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging.
Our goal is to build a diverse workplace where employees from all backgrounds and identities feel empowered to do their best work and build the future of trading — together.
How HRT Supports our Global Employees
At HRT, we are dedicated to building an environment that meets the dynamic needs of our employees. We believe the best way to foster inclusivity is to listen, reflect, and be curious. Here are some of the ways we cultivate a culture where everyone feels valued and empowered:
Employee-informed decision making
Formalized opportunities for honest feedback that directly informs future policy, Employee Resource Groups, and a dedicated DEIB Council to support employee-informed strategies and initiatives.
Ongoing Growth Opportunities
A wide scope of learning & development programming, and impactful guest speakers to offer additional perspectives and enhance our shared knowledge.
Building strong communities
Inclusive and accessible work environment, shared meals and events in the office, and a company-wide stipend for out of office gatherings.
Empowering inclusive leaders
Targeted management and leadership training around inclusive practices, and a DEIB mentorship program.
Meet Our Employee Resource Groups
We are proud to support our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) celebrating diverse voices and experiences across HRT. ERGs create space for employees to share resources, build networks of support, and establish community.

Addressing barriers for historically-excluded groups within tech and finance is critical to building an equitable future in our industry. We are proud to partner with organizations that support opportunities for everyone in STEM careers. Interested in partnering with us? Reach out to our team.

Featured Roles
Algorithm Developer
About The Role
Algo Developers are responsible for building and maintaining the models that drive our trading. A typical day involves applying rigorous statistical analysis to vast quantities of market and financial data to produce predictive trading models. You will run models live on our high-performance trading infrastructure, and analyze their daily performance to maintain ongoing profitability. Working in close collaboration with fellow algo developers and core developers, you will research, develop, and test novel order execution and model training methods to increase trading efficiency.
Am I right for this role?
We’re on the lookout for experienced mathematicians, computer scientists, statisticians, physicists and data scientists.
↳ Explore Job Openings
How an Algorithm Developer Navigates Dynamic Markets
Watch Now →
Amy’s Journey as a Software Engineer at HRT
Watch Now →
Software Engineer
About The Role
As a Software Engineer on HRT’s Core Development team, you will step into an incredible learning opportunity; HRT’s distributed system is on the Pareto frontier of latency and throughput. You’ll develop deep knowledge of C++, OS internals, CPU architecture, and networking hardware and protocols. And you will be surrounded by amazing developers who are honing their skills every day. You’ll be amazed at what you accomplish.
Am I right for this role?
We’re on the lookout for experienced coders, developers, and low level software engineers with experience in Python and C++.
↳ Explore Job Openings
Algo Software Engineer
About The Role
Algo Software Engineers (AEs) are programmers that work hand-in-hand with Algo Developers (ADs). As focus on the software that powers trading and research, and tend to be the type of engineers who thrive on constant interaction and discussion.
Hearing how their most recently-deployed system allowed for whole new types of research would make their week. AEs are engineers who don’t mind juggling a few projects at once and have a varied portfolio of projects, from long-term ambitious new systems to fire-fighting live issues.
Am I right for this role?
We’re on the lookout for experienced full-stack developers, technologists, programmers, developers, data analysts and visualization experts. Check back soon for upcoming opportunities.

subPages.content:
Life at HRT.
A place where kindness and excellence meet across six countries and nearly all the world’s electronic markets. Our global community spans a wide variety of disciplines and backgrounds, with a mutual commitment to curiosity and the pursuit of innovation that drives our collective success.
Explore Job Openings
Cultural SPOTLIGHT

HRT Shorts: What’s it like working at our London office?

Core Values
Automation & Efficiency
We are disciples of automation and efficiency, trading millions of times a day in markets around the globe. At its core, HRT is a small tech company with a big impact.
Collaboration
Collaboration sets HRT apart within our industry. We count among us many brilliant minds, but we’ve learned that the best ideas are born in a shared research and development environment.
Code of Ethics
Our internal code of ethics far exceeds the expectations of the regulatory environment in which we operate. We are conscientious market participants advocating for fair and transparent markets for everyone. This philosophy influences every aspect of our research.
Diversity & Inclusion
At HRT, we celebrate Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging. Our culture is a reflection of the individuals – across race, gender identity and expression, age, religion and worship practices, education status, nationality, and identity – who bring their varied perspectives to work.
Make it Better
Both as individuals and as a company we are tenacious. We are insatiable innovators looking to improve every aspect of our business. We don’t settle until we make it better.
Togetherness
HRT is a community of friends and colleagues. Whether we are sharing a meal or competing over a game of ping pong, HRT embraces a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.
Non-siloed and collaborative culture
On-site gym in NYC
Fully stocked kitchen, plus catered meals
Shared meals in our cafeteria

Perks & Benefits
Health Coverage
Family Support
Meals & Snacks
Inclusivity & Accessibility
Togetherness
Time Off
Fitness
Comfort

Professional Development
Financial Wellbeing
Health Coverage
Nothing is more important to us than employee health. At HRT, you can expect company-paid (no premiums!) medical and dental coverage across our global offices. We also offer HRT-funded Health Savings Accounts, uncapped sick days, affordable vision insurance, flexible spending accounts, and Modern Health memberships, which provide access to appointments with therapists and coaches for employees and their dependents at no cost.
Family Time
Supporting our employees also means supporting the people that they love. We offer comprehensive parental leave and family planning benefits to help HRTers prioritize family. US employees can access family planning support through Progyny, including egg freezing, fertility treatments, adoption and surrogacy benefits. Caregiver support, including back-up child care, is available through our partnership with Vivvi. We also host plenty of family-friendly events including kids' day, family nights, and company-wide trips.
Meals & Snacks
We take food very seriously. HRTers enjoy complimentary breakfasts and lunches, along with a wide selection of healthy snacks. Need a caffeine boost? Our coffee bar awaits. And for moments of relaxation, a well-stocked beer and wine fridge.
Inclusive & Accessible Environment
We offer gender-affirming health coverage (region-dependent), gender-neutral bathrooms in many of our offices, and support for HRTers who are transitioning at work. Private wellness rooms are available for meditation, prayer, lactation, or as a private space to attend a virtual appointment. We’re always looking for ways to remove barriers and empower employees of all abilities — if there’s a way we can make it easier for individuals to do their best work, we’re here for it.
Togetherness
Our social calendar includes regular outings like pottery, painting, pizza making, team dinners/happy hours, and an annual volleyball tournament. We take regular team retreats and company-wide trips to connect with each other (families included!) In-office, you can find us unwinding at the end of a long day with video games, happy hours, snack drops, wine/tea club, poker, or table tennis!
Time Off
We believe recharging is important, and time off is encouraged. Employees receive generous paid vacation along with personal days, market holidays, and company-wide trips.
Fitness
Enjoy an on-site cardio and weight room in NYC, complete with sweeping views that will make going to the gym even easier. And for those in our other offices, we've got you covered with a fitness reimbursement.
Comfort
Come as you are! Our dress code is whatever makes you feel comfortable, at ease, and able to do your best work — whether that be your favorite pair of sweatpants or runway best.
Hybrid Work
We recognize that different work carries different in-office needs: some teams require round-the-clock coverage or hands-on maintenance, while others operate across different continents and time zones. While the majority of teams adopt a fairly even split between in-office and remote work, many choose to come in every day.
Professional Development
Learning at HRT never stops. We offer employees reimbursement for career development courses, in-house professional learning & development opportunities, and a vibrant intellectual culture that presents daily opportunities to learn something new.
Financial Wellbeing
In addition to competitive compensation, we offer generous 401k matching to all full-time US employees, pension matching in our EU locations, and CPF contributions for employees in Singapore. Moving to a new city to start your career at HRT? Relocation assistance is available to support your move.
Our Offices
With offices from New York to Singapore, our reach extends to more than 200 markets worldwide. With a strong presence in six countries, our global teams enable us to trade thousands of financial products quickly and efficiently.
Learn More
Diversity, Equity,Inclusion & Belonging
We strive to build a diverse workplace where all HRTers feel welcomed and empowered to do their best work and build the future of trading — together.

Continued learning opportunities, mentorship and training, and an open collaborative culture empowers interns and new grads to have an immediate impact at HRT.

Across our global internships, students work on real projects in collaboration with experienced mentors and build their knowledge and skills through varied learning opportunities. From NYC to Singapore, interns can also look forward to a packed social calendar that takes advantage of all the city has to offer.

Full-time Roles for Graduating Students
If you’re graduating from a bachelor’s, master’s, or PhD program in 2026, consider one of our full-time roles. New hires are immersed in a robust training program that lets them hit the ground running on their new team.

They push boundaries in trading performance using advanced low-level logic design, low-latency hardware architectures, and novel solutions for hardware-software interaction.

FAQs
K
L
Do I need experience in financial markets to apply?
Nope! In fact, the majority of HRTers join us with no previous finance experience. You’ll have a chance to learn on the job and through our training program.
K
L
What programming languages are used in HRT interviews?
For Algorithm Developers, you will be able to choose between C++ and Python. For Software Engineering, you’ll indicate a preference for interviewing with either C++ or Python at the application stage.
K
L
Can I apply for more than one job at the same time?
Please only apply to one job posting. You will have the opportunity to indicate if you are interested in other offices or roles in the application questions.
K
L
What perks are available to interns?
Interns enjoy fully-paid housing, travel allowances, office amenities like an on-site gym and game room, chef-prepared breakfast and lunch, dinner stipends, and hands-on professional development opportunities.
But the internship experience expands far beyond the walls of our office — we want our interns to truly get to know their homes for the summer! Enjoy a vibrant social calendar of unforgettable events, from sporting events to food tours to live theater.
K
L
What’s the difference between an Algorithm Engineer and an Algorithm Developer?
At a high level, Algorithm Engineers are responsible for making the Algo team’s research tools and trading platform powerful, flexible, fast, and easy to use. In order to do this, AEs and SWEs work closely with Algo Developers to understand their needs.
Algorithm Developers build and maintain the models that drive our trading, working hand in hand with Algo Engineers to help test and deploy their strategies. Algorithm Developers rely on a mix of quantitative (math, stats, data analysis) and technical (C++/Python programming) skills in researching, backtesting, and monitoring new strategies.
Check out job descriptions and our YouTube channel for more details on role specifics!
K
L
What is your WFH policy?
Our internship is fully in-person to ensure interns take full advantage of opportunities to connect with HRTers and embed themselves in HRT’s culture.
Full-time roles follow a hybrid model that varies by team.
K
L
What happens after I submit my application? When will I hear back?
Our team will review your application and reach out via email about any next steps. Given the high volume of applicants, please allow up to 2 weeks for your application to be reviewed.
K
L
What does the interview process look like?
Technical interviews at HRT usually consist of a coding test, 1-2 technical phone screens, and a virtual multi-round final interview. Interview length and topics can vary depending on the role. Please review the job descriptions to see required skills for the role you are interested in!
K
L
What are the dates of the HRT internship programs?
Our summer internships run from late-May to mid-August. Our Winternship is a condensed program which takes place in January.

HRIS manager
"I enjoy how dynamic the work environment at G-Research is. It keeps you busy and continuously creates opportunities to develop yourself and your career, too."

Software Engineer

"G-Research makes a lot of effort to have a very open culture and gives a lot of freedom to its individual researchers to pursue directions that they think are valuable, with each researcher very much driving their own research. I didn’t feel like I was losing a lot of freedom compared to academia."

Software Engineer
"What I appreciate most about working in G-Research is the supportive and knowledgeable environment. Everyone is incredibly helpful and patient, which ensures there’s a good balance between being challenged and your workload."

Quantitative Researcher

Corporate IT Manager

Assessment process for quantitative research and machine learning
Our quantitative researchers and ML practitioners have a record of academic achievement in mathematics, physics, ML, computer science or engineering. There’s no need for experience in finance.
Online application
Quick and easy: We will ask for your CV/resume and a few personal details like your education and contact information. Our Talent Acquisition team will review your application to see if you are a good fit, and you will receive an update on the status of your application within one week of applying.
Interview preparation guide
Stage one: Online quant quiz
You will be asked to complete one of two quant quizzes: either a general quantitative aptitude assessment, or an ML specific one, depending on your background.
Recommended reading
Stage two: Technical interviews
Typically, you will sit four interviews, one of which will focus on in-depth technical questions in mathematics. Each interview will last one hour.
If your profile is better suited to ML, you’ll complete two one-hour interviews that focus on your ML knowledge. You should also expect questions on mathematics, programming and statistics that are relevant to the space.
Stage three: Leadership interviews
Following the successful completion of the technical interviews, you will meet some of our leaders.

Introduction
The G-Research group is committed to being a responsible taxpayer, complying with local tax laws and regulations and with OECD guidance. The primary objective of G-Research’s tax strategy is accurate and timely tax compliance. This includes the following:
To ensure local and international laws and regulations are complied with, and that OECD guidance is followed;
To ensure that all taxes, including corporation tax, employer taxes, employee withholding taxes, indirect taxes and other local taxes are paid in full and in a timely manner;
To provide training and guidance on tax matters to the business as required; and
To maintain a relationship with HMRC based on foundations of compliance and transparent communication.
Approach to Risk Management and Governance Arrangements in Relation to UK Taxation
Responsibility for G-Research’s tax contribution, tax risk, and governance sits with the respective entities’ governing bodies, which provide oversight and strategic direction. Day-to-day responsibility is delegated to the Head of Finance and the Head of Tax, supported by the wider Finance team.
G-Research’s tax compliance function is managed by its team of in-house qualified accountants, ensuring that tax decisions are informed and current. A control framework is in place to ensure that tax risks, including changes to relevant laws, regulations and guidance, are identified in a timely manner and subsequent action is taken to mitigate those risks to an acceptably low level. Tax risks and responses are documented to ensure that G-Research’s tax strategy remains transparent, and to ensure that it is communicated to and recognised by those in charge of governance.
Attitude Towards Tax Planning and Risk
G-Research does not consider tax planning to be a major driver in determining business strategy and key decision making. G-Research has a low-risk appetite in terms of tax planning opportunities.
We may utilise available tax reliefs and incentives where appropriate and in a manner which is consistent with the applicable law.
Tax advice will be sought from external advisors in respect of material transactions or when the Finance team do not have the necessary expertise required in a particular area. Significant transactions within, or changes to, the business are reviewed and approved by the governing bodies of the relevant entities.
Our Approach to Working With HMRC
G-Research looks to maintain an open, positive and cooperative working relationship with HMRC.
We are committed to working with HMRC to resolve any issues that arise and to providing appropriate disclosure of relevant facts to enable the progression of HMRC enquiries.

Mathematical modelling

Machine learning
Our researchers challenge the efficient market hypothesis every day, a task that demands more than textbook methods.
To stay ahead, they harness massive compute power and apply cutting-edge machine-learning techniques, whether drawn from the latest research or developed in-house. Innovation is essential; in a world of constant competition, only novel approaches deliver an edge.

Assessment process for quantitative research and machine learning
Our quantitative researchers and ML practitioners have a record of academic achievement in mathematics, physics, ML, computer science or engineering. There’s no need for experience in finance.
Online application
Quick and easy: We will ask for your CV/resume and a few personal details like your education and contact information. Our Talent Acquisition team will review your application to see if you are a good fit, and you will receive an update on the status of your application within one week of applying.
Interview preparation guide
Stage one: Online quant quiz
You will be asked to complete one of two quant quizzes: either a general quantitative aptitude assessment, or an ML specific one, depending on your background.
Recommended reading
Stage two: Technical interviews
Typically, you will sit four interviews, one of which will focus on in-depth technical questions in mathematics. Each interview will last one hour.
If your profile is better suited to ML, you’ll complete two one-hour interviews that focus on your ML knowledge. You should also expect questions on mathematics, programming and statistics that are relevant to the space.
Stage three: Leadership interviews
Following the successful completion of the technical interviews, you will meet some of our leaders.

We play an active role in the open-source community. We take responsibility for maintaining projects, contributing to the continual development of essential software and supporting open-source foundations.
Our work focuses on data science and machine-learning tools, as well as the infrastructure and security to support them.
Our open-source projects
Our work
We work with the Apache Spark, Apache Arrow and related communities within data science, as well as open-source alternatives for improved GPU support for .Net Core. We also look for general improvements to F#, C# and .Net Core ecosystems, to help our engineers.
Within infrastructure, we focus on OpenStack and Kubernetes, two deep ecosystems where our support is widespread. We are core contributors to both projects directly, but we also contribute to many tools that influence the CNCF and OpenInfra landscape. These include tools and projects such as Cilium, Prometheus, and Thanos, to name just a few.
Our security work is far-reaching too. We maintain the Consul.NET project, built the Aeron-vault plugin, and have identified dozens of meaningful CVE’s across Linux, Windows and MacOS. These are just a few highlights of our security advocacy.

Students and graduates
Our summer internships and year-long placement opportunities challenge curious minds through hands-on experience with real projects, access to leading training programmes and world-class mentor support.
01
Quantitative research
Learn more
Our annual 10-week Summer Research Programme gives our interns the opportunity to work on a meaningful project.
You’ll sit within a collaborative environment and employ rigorous scientific methodology to extract deep insights from an extensive data ecosystem, all under the stewardship of some of the world’s best research and ML talent.
02
Engineering and technology
Over the course of 12 or 24 weeks, our engineering interns gain real-world exposure to life at a tech-driven business.
Embedded in our Quantitative or Infrastructure Engineering teams, you’ll work on projects that enhance the world-class trading technology platforms we develop, evolve legacy systems and contribute to vital OpenStack work.
03
Corporate
Our long-term success is driven by support and collaboration across our teams – our corporate functions embody that.
We offer a range of placement opportunities within finance, legal, business analytics and human resources. Working closely with experienced colleagues, you will help us overcome the unique challenges experienced by a leading firm in a highly competitive industry.

I amsa. My name's Matthew. My name is Kasha. My name's Sophie. My name's Ben. All of the interns are supervised by a mentor who's a full-time quant researcher. On the day to day, we're doing a lot of coding, we're reading a lot of papers, we're trying to come up with some new maths, trying to bring it all together to solve an interesting problem. I'm intern in data science. Uh, the project I've been working on focus both on data analysis and inventing some strategies for trying to merge multiple time series into one. So my main focus, this internship, has been on developing visualization tools for various types of, uh, data sets that we currently process within the Team. My internship was in security operations. Machine Learning College
Our tailored learning programme brings renowned academic research and cutting-edge techniques directly to us, enabling our people to continuously build their knowledge, stay ahead of the curve and set us up for long-term success.
What is ML College?
ML College is our in-house learning programme. It’s designed to keep our ML practitioners at the forefront of the industry through a bespoke seminar and workshop programme.
Cutting-edge research and tailored learning
ML College has two key components:
Monthly seminars: World-renowned academic researchers showcase their latest research
Implementation workshops: In-depth, practical sessions where we explore how we can deploy the latest techniques
ML skills to put into practice
ML College enables our people to continuously learn and hone their skills, while equipping them with the practical knowledge to put theory into practice.
For those less familiar with ML, we provide a number of on-demand learning units specific to methods our researchers use.
World renowned academics
We invite world renowned academics to present their research, giving real insight into cutting-edge ML developments in an intimate setting. Past speakers include:
Tim Sainburg, UCSD: Parametric UMAP: learning embeddings with deep neural networks for representation and semi-supervised learning
Michael Dennis, UC Berkeley: Unsupervised Environment Design for Transfer in RL
Colin Wei, Stanford University: Theoretical Analysis of Self-Training with Deep Networks on Unlabelled Data

As Europe’s leading quantitative finance research firm, G-Research hires the brightest minds from around the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in our industry. This is irrespective of gender, race, religion, sexuality or any other characteristic.
The statistics reflect that the best paying roles in our business require undergraduate and in many cases postgraduate study in maths, computer science, the physical sciences and technology. Men account for roughly three times as many graduates* in these subjects as women and have done for many years and so not surprisingly, men hold more of the best paying roles in our business. We believe this gender imbalance is a missed opportunity for the industry and we welcome applications from smart, qualified women who are interested in what we do.

Introduction
The G-Research group is committed to being a responsible taxpayer, complying with local tax laws and regulations and with OECD guidance. The primary objective of G-Research’s tax strategy is accurate and timely tax compliance. This includes the following:
To ensure local and international laws and regulations are complied with, and that OECD guidance is followed;
To ensure that all taxes, including corporation tax, employer taxes, employee withholding taxes, indirect taxes and other local taxes are paid in full and in a timely manner;
To provide training and guidance on tax matters to the business as required; and
To maintain a relationship with HMRC based on foundations of compliance and transparent communication.
Approach to Risk Management and Governance Arrangements in Relation to UK Taxation
Responsibility for G-Research’s tax contribution, tax risk, and governance sits with the respective entities’ governing bodies, which provide oversight and strategic direction. Day-to-day responsibility is delegated to the Head of Finance and the Head of Tax, supported by the wider Finance team.
G-Research’s tax compliance function is managed by its team of in-house qualified accountants, ensuring that tax decisions are informed and current. A control framework is in place to ensure that tax risks, including changes to relevant laws, regulations and guidance, are identified in a timely manner and subsequent action is taken to mitigate those risks to an acceptably low level. Tax risks and responses are documented to ensure that G-Research’s tax strategy remains transparent, and to ensure that it is communicated to and recognised by those in charge of governance.
Attitude Towards Tax Planning and Risk
G-Research does not consider tax planning to be a major driver in determining business strategy and key decision making. G-Research has a low-risk appetite in terms of tax planning opportunities.
We may utilise available tax reliefs and incentives where appropriate and in a manner which is consistent with the applicable law.
Tax advice will be sought from external advisors in respect of material transactions or when the Finance team do not have the necessary expertise required in a particular area. Significant transactions within, or changes to, the business are reviewed and approved by the governing bodies of the relevant entities.
Our Approach to Working With HMRC
G-Research looks to maintain an open, positive and cooperative working relationship with HMRC.
We are committed to working with HMRC to resolve any issues that arise and to providing appropriate disclosure of relevant facts to enable the progression of HMRC enquiries.
This strategy statement has been prepared in accordance with paragraphs 19(2) and 25 of Schedule 19 of the Finance Act 2016 and provides an overview of G-Research’s policy and approach to its tax affairs for the financial period ended 31 March 2025. This strategy was published on 27 March 2025.
This statement is made on behalf of Alastair LLP in respect of the financial period ending 31 March
2025 and has been duly approved.
This is our slavery and human trafficking statement for the purposes of section 54(1) of the Modern
Slavery Act 2015.
We endeavour to ensure that there is no slavery or human trafficking in our supply chains or
business.
We provide corporate support services (including, but not limited to, human resources, legal,
finance, operational risk management and premises). We also provide staff to certain related
entities. We consider the risk of slavery or human trafficking within our supply chain to be low since
we have straightforward supply chains compared with other sectors in the UK, and the majority of
the service providers we use are based in the UK. We will not knowingly do business with any
suppliers who are involved in slavery. As we do not have intricate or complex supply chains, no
further action with regards to slavery or human trafficking has been deemed necessary at this time.
Our recruitment processes are reviewed regularly. We have robust procedures in place for the
vetting of new staff. We ensure that we are able to confirm their identities and that they are paid
directly into a personal bank account. We confirm that staff have the right to work in the UK and are
aware of their rights and responsibilities associated with working in the UK. We have policies and
procedures in place to ensure compliance with all applicable laws. All staff are properly remunerated
at a level above the UK’s national living wage.
Approved and signed by the LLP Designated Members of Alastair LLP

We work at the cutting edge.
You could help us stay there
Submit company info
At G-Research, we combine cutting-edge technology, exceptional talent, and massive compute to predict movements in global financial markets.
We rely on the world’s most advanced software and hardware to stay ahead of the market, which is why we are always on the lookout for technologies that can keep us on the leading edge. Whether your company is a startup with a handful of PhDs or a technology industry leader, we want to hear how you could support us.
Why should you become a partner vendor? You’ll have the opportunity to tackle real-world problems at scale and develop your roadmap alongside a partner focused on the long-term.
Tell us about what you do
If you think your company could support G-Research, complete the short form below.
Your information will be reviewed by our team.
Submit your details to speak to our team
Your one-page submission (your “Proposal”) should be a high-level summary of your idea, concept, business, pitch or proposal, simply to give us an idea of what you do. If we are interested in your Proposal, we will enter into an NDA to allow both parties to enter into more detailed discussions.
By submitting a Proposal, you acknowledge and agree that:
We are under no obligation to review, respond to, or act upon any Proposal.
We may already be independently developing, or may in the future develop, products, services, or ideas similar or identical to your Proposal. You waive any claim that we have misused or misappropriated your ideas, even if they are similar to existing or future company activities.
You have the right to submit your Proposal to us.
You are responsible for ensuring your Proposal complies with all applicable laws, that it does not infringe on the intellectual property rights of any third party, and does not contain any material that is unlawful, confidential, proprietary to a third party, or otherwise restricted.
Personal data collected as part of the submission of your Proposal will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy, available here. Please review it to understand how we collect, use, and store your personal information.

subPages.content: Talent DevelopmentAdvance at a firm that invests in your success Talent development is a strategic priority at Balyasny—for ourselves and our investors. subPages.content: NewsFrom intern to full-time engineerJul 29, 2025Anna Gietl started at Balyasny as an intern in 2022 and returned the following year as part of our Technology Academy. Today she is a full-time engineer on the Equity PCA Technology team in Chicago, where she develops quantitative equity strategy solutions. Sharing skills for successHear from Anna as she details her experience at BAM, what it has been like to work on an innovative team, and the opportunities she has seen for growth. This rotational program allows early career technologists find the placement that best matches their skills and interests. “It was great to have an opportunity to try different things out and see what I liked,” said Anna. “There is so much opportunity for growth with the mentorship that you have here.”Anna GietlCareers at BAMTo learn more about open opportunities at Balyasny, visit our careers page.

Our mission We improve the market
As a leading proprietary trading firm, Optiver works to make markets more efficient, transparent and stable for all. We have close to 2,000 employees in offices around the world, united in their commitment to providing liquidity, competitive pricing and reliable risk management.
market making
As a leading market maker, we are active on multiple exchanges across the globe, trading options, futures, equities, FX, fixed income and commodities products.
Improving the market is a responsibility we don’t take lightly
Consistent liquidity
Markets need liquidity to function effectively. We trade our own capital at our own risk to provide just that.
Globally trusted
Working with exchanges across the globe, we provide continuous prices for thousands of financial instruments.
A stabilising force
No matter the market conditions, we stay the course – even during times of volatility.
Optiver’s values

We improve the market.

We take ownership

Trusted partner,always there
We provide institutional investors around the globe with liquidity in equities, FX, fixed income and commodity products. We do this by offering consistently competitive prices in options, futures and ETFs in major markets.
We realise the importance of being there, especially in times of uncertainty. When markets become turbulent, we stay resolute in our commitment to provide liquidity to help institutions manage risk and execute their investment strategies.
our expertise
We know what is important to you
Competitive prices
Consistent, competitive and fair. That’s what we stand for. We leverage our expansive view and prime market position to always provide competitive prices.
Consistency
Our global footprint and the scale of our operations allow us to aggregate risk and keep spreads consistently tight for those who trade with us, even in times of extreme volatility.
Responsiveness
We pride ourselves on responding to the needs and trading priorities of the 600+ institutions, funds, banks and merchants who count on us. We recognise the importance of implementation that limits market impact and preserves anonymity.

========================================

The Optiver Foundation
Creating meaningful impact
The Optiver Foundation is a global non-profit organisation committed to funding practical, enduring solutions that spur environmental action and promote diversity. Drawing on our heritage, we believe in the power of science, technology and education as transformative tools to drive positive changes for our global community.
Charting a path to positive change
The Optiver Foundation has a distinct focus as we respond to some of the critical challenges confronting our world today. We support initiatives that address ecological sustainability and advocate for access to education as a pathway to equal opportunities. We aim to create an impactful legacy, ensuring a safer, healthier and more inclusive future for generations to come.
oUR areas of focus
Environmental action
Environmental action is a prerequisite to achieving a prosperous and sustainable future for all. From reforestation to water conservation to reducing carbon emissions, we seek to play an active role in helping reverse the impact of climate change.
oUR areas of focus
Diversity
An inclusive and diverse workforce fosters a culture of trust and respect and strengthens our ability to innovate and thrive. We all have a role to play in creating equal opportunities for others. One way is through increasing access to education. In many parts of the world, talented young people lack opportunity. We can change this by empowering future generations through access to learning opportunities.
oUR PROJECTS
Scholarship programme with Oxford University
The Optiver Foundation has partnered with Oxford University to launch an international scholarship programme, that’s focussed on supporting women, from low and middle-income countries, to access STEM education at a postgraduate level. The programme will provide support for 30 master’s students over a period of five years. Scholars will receive full financial support for their course fees, as well as a stipend to cover living costs. The programme will also enable scholars to access tailored induction activities, mentoring and on-course support.
Read more
oUR PROJECTS
Providing equal opportunity to STEM
The Optiver Foundation has joined forces with Women Win to develop ‘Stemming the Gap: the Free STEM Fund.’ The fund envisions providing grants to youth-led, women-led and community-based organisations, social enterprises and educational institutions in the global south (including Latin America, Asia, Africa, and Oceania). Women Win will manage the fund using its unique approach to inclusive and participatory philanthropy.
TheFreeSTEMFund.org
Image credit: John Cairns
oUR PROJECTS
UNSW programme to boost diversity in STEM
The Optiver Foundation is proud to support Future You, a ground-breaking programme by the University of New South Wales (UNSW), empowering the next generation of diverse and innovative STEM leaders with a transformative grant.  The program aims to educate children, aged eight to twelve, about STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) subjects and inspire them to explore future career possibilities.

oUR areas of focus
Environmental action
Environmental action is a prerequisite to achieving a prosperous and sustainable future for all. From reforestation to water conservation to reducing carbon emissions, we seek to play an active role in helping reverse the impact of climate change.
oUR areas of focus
Diversity
An inclusive and diverse workforce fosters a culture of trust and respect and strengthens our ability to innovate and thrive. We all have a role to play in creating equal opportunities for others. One way is through increasing access to education. In many parts of the world, talented young people lack opportunity. We can change this by empowering future generations through access to learning opportunities.
oUR PROJECTS
Scholarship programme with Oxford University
The Optiver Foundation has partnered with Oxford University to launch an international scholarship programme, that’s focussed on supporting women, from low and middle-income countries, to access STEM education at a postgraduate level. The programme will provide support for 30 master’s students over a period of five years. Scholars will receive full financial support for their course fees, as well as a stipend to cover living costs. The programme will also enable scholars to access tailored induction activities, mentoring and on-course support.
Read more
oUR PROJECTS
Providing equal opportunity to STEM
The Optiver Foundation has joined forces with Women Win to develop ‘Stemming the Gap: the Free STEM Fund.’ The fund envisions providing grants to youth-led, women-led and community-based organisations, social enterprises and educational institutions in the global south (including Latin America, Asia, Africa, and Oceania). Women Win will manage the fund using its unique approach to inclusive and participatory philanthropy.

Prompting his choice of topic was a recent change in CPython, as Samet explained:
“Beginning with version 3.13, CPython introduces an option for a build known as free threading, where the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) is removed. The question is: With the GIL gone, do we still need async in Python?”

“Beginning with version 3.13, CPython introduces an option for a build known as free threading, where the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) is removed. The question is: With the GIL gone, do we still need async in Python?”

Data Science & Research
Apply now
data science & Research
Data scientists and researchers improve our trading strategies
How does Optiver continuously price hundreds of thousands of financial products in real-time? One word: Data.
Data science and research are at the very core of Optiver’s pricing strategies. Our teams tackle challenges at the intersection of technology and trading – where some of the most complex and valuable financial market data resides. With world-class skills that cut through the noise, Optiver’s data science and research teams directly contribute to the precision and scalability of our trading business.
data science
Find YourPerfect Fit
Data analytics
It all starts with the exchanges, where we monitor a constant stream of trades and prices. All of this information must be collected, processed and relayed to both human traders and automated strategies alike.
These data sets present their own complexities, including a typically very low signal-to-noise ratio. Our analysts must combine data science with a solid understanding of data lineage and trading dynamics to cut through the noise. In this way, we can continuously improve trading logics and remain performant even during periods of market turbulence.
Data science
Data scientists at Optiver apply their advanced engineering and machine learning skills to develop and improve our trading strategies. They sit on our trading floor – the beating heart of our business – to share market insights with traders, quantitative researchers and developers. Our data scientists’ observations and recommendations inform crucial trading decisions in real-time, making them trusted and highly-valued colleagues.
Optiver’s data scientists collaborate with data analysts, data engineers, quantitative researchers and traders. It’s a fascinating role that requires a strong coding background and problem-solving skills.
Mathematical modelling
Optiver’s researchers develop sophisticated models that take market dynamics into account to consistently price tens of thousands of instruments. These models must be flexible enough to account for the nuances of the market while at the same time remaining sound and robust. By working together with traders and software engineers, our researchers strive to continuously unlock solutions that further strengthen our pricing.
Machine learning
Machine learning is heavily utilised at Optiver to predict how markets might perform in the future. Based on these implied findings, data scientists convert immense amounts of historical data into trading signals. The goal is improving our prediction accuracy. To do so, Optiver is constantly looking for innovative ways to derive useful insights from the data.
Infrastructure & pipeline
Optiver’s data science activities wouldn’t exist without our state-of-the-art data infrastructure. Our growing team of data engineers is dedicated to building a cutting-edge, big data pipeline to ensure the real-time availability of terabytes of market data. Each year our Amsterdam office alone processes market data in the magnitude of petabytes. With the help of highly skilled data analysts, who combine data processing skills with a thorough understanding of strategies, we make sure the data tells a story.
Quantitative research
Quantitative research is the foundation upon which Optiver’s trading activities are built. Our research teams – experts with MSc and PhD degrees in a variety of STEM subjects – utilise a scientific approach to research and design our world-class trading algorithms. This means applying and developing state-of-the-art stochastic models to price options and predict market volatility, as well as utilising Monte Carlo methods to determine how to perform differentiation on discrete realisations of stochastic processes. Our researchers develop statistical arbitrage strategies by working with petabytes of low latency, high-frequency market data sets, an extensive high-powered computing back-testing framework and much more.
Optiver’s researchers, steeped in academic methods, invite their teammates and traders to challenge each hypothesis. Can it be mathematically improved? Does it pose a potential risk? Does it exploit a market behavioural pattern? Can it sustain its output goals? Constant testing, analysis, refinement and innovation ensure our quantitative models remain at the cutting-edge of capital markets.
