We invest via convertible notes, such as SAFEs, or via straight equity subscriptions. On the token side, we do SAFTs, as well as Token Warrants or Token Purchase Agreements. We are committed to remaining flexible in our investment model to fit the needs of our portfolio companies. What stages does Wintermute Venture invest in?Most of our investments focus is on early-stage (pre-seed to Series A) startups, but we also participate in later stage deals. What are Wintermute Venture’s main investment criteria?We focus on category-defining startups with the boldness to redefine entire sectors and industries. We focus on founders who have a strong vision, who are willing to be coached throughout their growth journey.Does an investment mandate a liquidity partnership with Wintermute?In contrast to other trading firms, we don’t force our portfolio companies into a commercial relationship with our trading business. We act and think as independent venture investors and as such, we encourage companies to work with any liquidity provider that meets their needs. What is Wintermute Venture’s usual ticket size?We don’t have a “usual” ticket size. One of our greatest strengths is our flexible mandate, which allows us to adjust our ticket size depending on how much the company is looking to raise. Can Wintermute Venture lead investment rounds?We often lead and co-lead investment rounds; however, given the flexibility of our mandate, we are open to following the terms set by another lead VC.VenturesApply To get funding and build with usContactContactTo reach Wintermute VenturesVentures › PortfolioPortfolioTo view our portfolio companies

The Bending Spoons valuesWe’re climbersAmbitionSetting and upholding high goals and standards that stretch the boundaries of what you perceive to be possible.CourageOvercoming fear when it stands in the way of doing the right thing.DedicationAlways giving your best as you diligently progress toward the goal.Long-term orientationSeeking to optimize with a long-term view, even at the expense of short-term victories.OptimismBelieving that, through smart and hard work, you can make the future better than the present.OwnershipFeeling deeply responsible for your work, and continually taking the initiative.PassionFinding pleasure and purpose in doing the work in pursuit of the goal.TenacityNot giving up in front of an obstacle, treating failure as valuable feedback, and picking yourself up swiftly after every fall.We’re scientistsAccuracyTelling the truth, and being explicit about what’s a fact and what’s a hypothesis.CuriositySeeking an understanding of the whats, hows, and whys of the world.ImaginationEnvisioning how things could be, unencumbered by how they currently are.LogicReasoning from first principles, and structuring ideas sharply.MeritocracyAssigning responsibilities solely based on people’s ability to carry them out, and evaluating ideas regardless of where or whom they came from.PragmatismOptimizing for impact, finding the right scope—and the ideal balance between speed and sophistication—at all times.PrecisionIdentifying and taking care of the details that matter.RationalityResisting the influence of biases.ResearchGathering all relevant information, and rigorously testing hypotheses.We’re openDiversitySeeking to be exposed to a variety of people, perspectives, and experiences, and assessing them with an open mind.FreedomAffording others considerable latitude of action, and providing them with ample opportunity to prove themselves.InclusivityTreating all others in the same respectful and caring way, no matter their individual characteristics and preferences.Self-criticismSoliciting and receiving feedback with a grateful attitude.ToleranceRespecting others and their opinions, particularly when you don’t see eye to eye with them.TransparencyMaking relevant information as accessible as possible—even when it feels uncomfortable to do so.We’re a tribeAltruismGiving generously and without the expectation of receiving in return.AuthenticityInteracting informally and bringing your true self wherever you go.BondingInvesting in creating rich, lasting relationships.CollaborationTaking steps to help the group work together seamlessly.EmpathyStepping outside of yourself to stand in the shoes of others.HumilityBehaving without arrogance or entitlement, regardless of position or past achievements.PositivityUplifting others by having fun and highlighting the bright side of challenges.TrustMeaning well in all you do, and assuming others mean well unless proven otherwise.It’s not allabout usWe’re thankful for the opportunities the world affords us, and strive to improve things for others.Join our teamExplore careers

subPages.title: The Bending Spoons values
subPages.content: The Bending Spoons valuesWe’re climbersAmbitionSetting and upholding high goals and standards that stretch the boundaries of what you perceive to be possible.CourageOvercoming fear when it stands in the way of doing the right thing.DedicationAlways giving your best as you diligently progress toward the goal.Long-term orientationSeeking to optimize with a long-term view, even at the expense of short-term victories.OptimismBelieving that, through smart and hard work, you can make the future better than the present.OwnershipFeeling deeply responsible for your work, and continually taking the initiative.PassionFinding pleasure and purpose in doing the work in pursuit of the goal.TenacityNot giving up in front of an obstacle, treating failure as valuable feedback, and picking yourself up swiftly after every fall.We’re scientistsAccuracyTelling the truth, and being explicit about what’s a fact and what’s a hypothesis.CuriositySeeking an understanding of the whats, hows, and whys of the world.ImaginationEnvisioning how things could be, unencumbered by how they currently are.LogicReasoning from first principles, and structuring ideas sharply.MeritocracyAssigning responsibilities solely based on people’s ability to carry them out, and evaluating ideas regardless of where or whom they came from.PragmatismOptimizing for impact, finding the right scope—and the ideal balance between speed and sophistication—at all times.PrecisionIdentifying and taking care of the details that matter.RationalityResisting the influence of biases.ResearchGathering all relevant information, and rigorously testing hypotheses.We’re openDiversitySeeking to be exposed to a variety of people, perspectives, and experiences, and assessing them with an open mind.FreedomAffording others considerable latitude of action, and providing them with ample opportunity to prove themselves.InclusivityTreating all others in the same respectful and caring way, no matter their individual characteristics and preferences.Self-criticismSoliciting and receiving feedback with a grateful attitude.ToleranceRespecting others and their opinions, particularly when you don’t see eye to eye with them.TransparencyMaking relevant information as accessible as possible—even when it feels uncomfortable to do so.We’re a tribeAltruismGiving generously and without the expectation of receiving in return.AuthenticityInteracting informally and bringing your true self wherever you go.BondingInvesting in creating rich, lasting relationships.CollaborationTaking steps to help the group work together seamlessly.EmpathyStepping outside of yourself to stand in the shoes of others.HumilityBehaving without arrogance or entitlement, regardless of position or past achievements.PositivityUplifting others by having fun and highlighting the bright side of challenges.TrustMeaning well in all you do, and assuming others mean well unless proven otherwise.It’s not allabout usWe’re thankful for the opportunities the world affords us, and strive to improve things for others.Join our teamExplore careers

companies.name: Anthropic
companies.description: Anthropic is an AI safety and research company that's working to build reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems.
companies.mainPageContent: Shape how AI meets  the worldAnthropic builds Claude—AI designed to be helpful, honest, and harmless. We're researchers, engineers, and builders from a range of disciplines, working to make sure powerful AI goes well for everyone. If you're drawn to hard problems with real stakes, we'd like to meet you.Explore open rolesBuilding AnthropicOur co-founders discuss the origins of Anthropic, the “race to the top” in AI development, and where AI technology will go from here.Principles that guide how we show up for each other and our missionAct for the global goodWe strive to make decisions that maximize positive outcomes for humanity in the long run. This means we’re willing to be very bold in the actions we take to ensure our technology is a robustly positive force for good. We take seriously the task of safely guiding the world through a technological revolution that has the potential to change the course of human history, and are committed to helping make this transition go well.Hold light and shadeAI has the potential to pose unprecedented risks to humanity if things go badly. It also has the potential to create unprecedented benefits for humanity if things go well. We need shade to understand and protect against the potential for bad outcomes. We need light to realize the good outcomes.Be good to our usersAt Anthropic, we define “users” broadly. Users are our customers, policy-makers, Ants, and anyone impacted by the technology we build or the actions we take. We cultivate generosity and kindness in all our interactions—with each other, with our users, and with the world at large. Going above and beyond for each other, our customers, and all of the people affected by our technology is meeting expectations.Ignite a race to the top on safetyAs a safety-first company, we believe that building reliable, trustworthy, and secure systems is our collective responsibility—and the market agrees. We work to inspire a ‘race to the top’ dynamic where AI developers must compete to develop the most safe and secure AI systems. We want to constantly set the industry bar for AI safety and security and drive others to do the same.Do the simple thing that worksWe take an empirical approach to problems and care about the size of our impact and not the sophistication of our methods. This doesn’t mean we throw together haphazard solutions. It means we try to identify the simplest solution and iterate from there. We don’t invent a spaceship if all we need is a bicycle.Be helpful, honest, and harmlessAnthropic is a high-trust, low-ego organization. We communicate kindly and directly, assuming good intentions even in disagreement. We are thoughtful about our actions, avoiding harm and repairing relationships when needed. Everyone contributes, regardless of role. If something urgently needs to be done, the right person to do it is probably you!Put the mission firstAt the end of the day, the mission is what we’re all here for. It gives us a shared purpose and allows us to act swiftly together, rather than being pulled in multiple directions by competing goals. It engenders trust and collaboration and is the final arbiter in our decisions. When it comes to our mission, none of us are bystanders. We each take personal ownership over making our mission successful.01 /07How we support youWe want you to thrive at work and feel confident that you and your family are taken care of. That means comprehensive benefits, competitive compensation, and resources to help you do your best work.Health and wellnessComprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your dependentsInclusive fertility benefits via Carrot Fertility22 weeks of paid parental leaveFlexible paid time off and absence policiesMental health support for you and your dependentsCompensation and supportCompetitive salary and equity packagesOptional equity donation matching at a 1:1 ratio, up to 25% of your equity grantRetirement plans with competitive matchingLife and income protection plansAdditional benefits$500/month flexible wellness and time saver stipendCommuter benefitsAnnual education stipendHome office stipendsRelocation support for those moving for AnthropicDaily meals and snacks in the officeHow we hireOur interview process is designed to find thoughtful people with diverse expertise. Here’s what to expect.What we are looking forWe care about what you can do, not where you learned to do it. About half our technical staff had no prior ML experience; about half have PhDs, but plenty of brilliant colleagues never went to college. If you’ve done interesting independent research, written a thoughtful blog post, or contributed to open source, put that at the top of your resume.One thing worth knowing: engineers here do lots of research, and researchers do lots of engineering. If you have an engineering background, apply as an engineer—you’ll perform better in the interviews, and you’ll have as much input into Anthropic’s direction as anyone else. All our papers have engineers as authors, often as first author.For non-technical roles, we’re looking for people who bring clarity, judgment, and a genuine interest in the mission. Our policy, operations, and business teams are small and high-impact. You’ll shape how we work, not just execute on a playbook.The interview processAll interviews are conducted over Google Meet, and we can accommodate a variety of timezones.For technical roles, we use live coding tools like Colab and CodeSignal. You can look things up—just be comfortable with basic syntax and standard libraries so it doesn’t eat up your time. We’ll ask about your experience and what motivates you, and you'll have time to ask us about Anthropic.For non-technical roles, interviews are conversational. We want to understand how you think through problems and what draws you to this work.You’ll have time to ask us about Anthropic too. We want this to be a two-way conversation.Your safety matters to usTo protect yourself from potential scams, remember that Anthropic recruiters only contact you from @anthropic.com email addresses. Be cautious of emails from other domains. Legitimate Anthropic recruiters will never ask for money, fees, or banking information before your first day. If you're ever unsure about a communication, don't click any links—visit anthropic.com/careers directly for confirmed position openings.Privacy policiesWe're committed to protecting your personal information throughout the hiring process. Review the privacy policy for your region below.United StatesIndiaAU, UK, EU, CH, KR AND JPAU, UK, EU, CH, KR AND JP (French)AU, UK, EU, CH, KR AND JP (Japanese)Our policy for using AI in our application processHere's when and how to use Claude (or other AI tools) when applying to and interviewing with Anthropic. Where it makes sense, we invite you to use Claude to show us more of you: your unique perspective, skills, and experiences.Read moreFrequently asked questionsDo you offer internships?We don’t currently offer internships.Can I get feedback on my application or interview?We’re not able to provide feedback on resumes or interviews.Can I re-apply if I’m not selected?Yes—you’re welcome to re-apply after 12 months, or sooner if something materially changes about your experience or skills.How long do I have to decide on an offer?Take your time. We’re happy to give you space to think and finish any other interview processes you’re going through.Do you sponsor visas?Yes. We sponsor visas and green cards, though some operations roles are harder to support. If we make you an offer, we’ll make every effort to get you here.What’s your remote work policy?Most staff are in the Bay Area and come to the office regularly. Some live further away and come in for one week a month. We can also be flexible during a transition period if you’re relocating.Want to help us build the future of safe AI?Explore open roles

subPages.title: Research
subPages.content: ResearchOur research teams investigate the safety, inner workings, and societal impacts of AI models – so that artificial intelligence has a positive impact as it becomes increasingly capable.Research teams:AlignmentEconomic ResearchInterpretabilitySocietal ImpactsInterpretabilityThe mission of the Interpretability team is to discover and understand how large language models work internally, as a foundation for AI safety and positive outcomes.AlignmentThe Alignment team works to understand the risks of AI models and develop ways to ensure that future ones remain helpful, honest, and harmless.Societal ImpactsWorking closely with the Anthropic Policy and Safeguards teams, Societal Impacts is a technical research team that explores how AI is used in the real world.Frontier Red TeamThe Frontier Red Team analyzes the implications of frontier AI models for cybersecurity, biosecurity, and autonomous systems.Project Vend: Phase twoPolicyDec 18, 2025In June, we revealed that we’d set up a small shop in our San Francisco office lunchroom, run by an AI shopkeeper. It was part of Project Vend, a free-form experiment exploring how well AIs could do on complex, real-world tasks. How has Claude's business been since we last wrote? InterpretabilityOct 29, 2025Signs of introspection in large language modelsCan Claude access and report on its own internal states? This research finds evidence for a limited but functional ability to introspect—a step toward understanding what's actually happening inside these models.InterpretabilityMar 27, 2025Tracing the thoughts of a large language modelCircuit tracing lets us watch Claude think, uncovering a shared conceptual space where reasoning happens before being translated into language—suggesting the model can learn something in one language and apply it in another.AlignmentFeb 3, 2025Constitutional Classifiers: Defending against universal jailbreaksThese classifiers filter the overwhelming majority of jailbreaks while maintaining practical deployment. A prototype withstood over 3,000 hours of red teaming with no universal jailbreak discovered.AlignmentDec 18, 2024Alignment faking in large language modelsThis paper provides the first empirical example of a model engaging in alignment faking without being trained to do so—selectively complying with training objectives while strategically preserving existing preferences.PublicationsSearchDateCategoryTitleJan 29, 2026AlignmentHow AI assistance impacts the formation of coding skillsJan 28, 2026AlignmentDisempowerment patterns in real-world AI usageJan 22, 2026AnnouncementsClaude's new constitutionJan 19, 2026InterpretabilityThe assistant axis: situating and stabilizing the character of large language modelsJan 15, 2026Economic ResearchAnthropic Economic Index: new building blocks for understanding AI useJan 15, 2026Economic ResearchAnthropic Economic Index report: economic primitivesJan 9, 2026AlignmentNext-generation Constitutional Classifiers: More efficient protection against universal jailbreaksDec 19, 2025AlignmentIntroducing Bloom: an open source tool for automated behavioral evaluationsDec 18, 2025PolicyProject Vend: Phase twoDec 4, 2025Societal ImpactsIntroducing Anthropic Interviewer: What 1,250 professionals told us about working with AI See moreJoin the Research teamSee open roles

Careers at GoodnotesGoodnotes was created from our founder's frustration of taking readable and reusable handwritten notes on his first iPad. We have since grown to millions of happy users. We are just getting started. Come join us!See Open RolesOur StoryWhen the iPad was released in April of 2010, I was a second-year Maths student in Australia. I received the iPad on the first day it was released, and I was immediately impressed by the possibilities of a large touchscreen.‍Programming has been my hobby since I was ten, but being able to "touch" the app was an amazing new experience...Read more on our blogLife at GoodnotesOur ValuesTake a look at our interview process and company values.Our BlogKeep up to date with our product and peopleSeek the diversity that makes us strongerGoodnotes is committed to improving Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, through training sessions, speakers and initiatives ran by our DEI Squad.GoodCultureWe work hard to create a collaborative and fun environment for GoodPeople to enjoy.Benefits💰 Competitive salary‍📈 Stock options - meaningful equity in a profitable tech-startup‍📅 Excellent annual leave package + public holidays‍🕒 Flexible working hours and location, we are remote friendly!‍😷 Medical insurance for you and your family‍🎓 Continuous learning - a learning and development budget for training or courses to build your skills‍📚 Be your best self - a monthly budget for personal growth including books, language/music lessons and online courses🎧 Noise-cancelling headphones💪 Monthly wellness budget - covering gym membership, therapy, massage and much, much more‍🏢 Amazing office space in central London and Hong Kong. Your travel and lunch are also on us!‍💻 Home office set up - everything you need to create a productive workspace at home. Chairs, desks, hardware: it’s all covered‍✈️ Sponsored working visa with a relocation package to either of our office locations‍🏝 Annual team off-site - get to know your colleagues‍☕️ Professional coffee equipment and freshly roasted beans in our officesGoodnotes Job Openings
See our Candidate Privacy NoticeFAQsWhat is the official language of Goodnotes?Everything happens in English.How big is the Goodnotes team?As of Q1 2023, we’re 150 people and still growing!How is the company structured?Goodnotes is structured into product and business teams. We have Managers and Leads to ensure the team is happy and projects are running smoothly.How is Goodnotes funded?We are a bootstrapped company and have been profitable since the day Goodnotes was launched on the AppStore in 2011. We have ownership over our quality, goals and timelines and we are not considering investors currently.How long does the interview process take?From your first conversation with the Talent Team to your final stage interview takes around 4 weeks on average, though this can vary slightly depending on the time of year. However your talent representative is always on hand to answer your questions and keep you informed. We are of course flexible, if you need us to speed things up then we will do our very best to accommodate.Where are you based and where can I work?We have offices in London and Hong Kong. We support 100% remote working from many countries across Europe and Asia – just let us know your preference when you apply. All we ask is that you have at least three hours overlap with Hong Kong and London business hours each day. All meetings and company updates happen during this time and anything outside of this is yours to own.Does Goodnotes sponsor visas?Yes, we sponsor visas for you and your family member (lawful spouse or child) in both the UK and Hong Kong, depending on local employment laws.Will Goodnotes assist me in relocating? Sure thing! If we are able to sponsor your visa and you wish to join us in our London or Hong Kong office then we will cover one set of economy one-way direct flight tickets for you and your family in addition to 1 month of accommodation.How is performance measured?Performance reviews take place twice a year in June and December. We believe that we grow through others’ questions and feedback. Each team also hosts feedback sessions at the end of every 2-month cycle to help identify our blindspots, learn and grow fast.Follow us!

Join us as a Goodnotes Marketplace CreatorShare your product now and start earning in no time!Submit a productGet discovered by 25 million usersYour digital stationery can reach millions of learners, planners, and creators who actively use Goodnotes every month.Turn your passion into incomeShare what you love — whether it's planners, templates, or study tools, and earn with every download.Ongoing promotion opportunitiesWith monthly campaigns and curated promotions, your products have constant opportunities to be seen, shared, and loved.The real voices from our creator community“Selling here opened up my creative thinking — new trends and fresh customers keep me excited to grow”.The Butter and ScotchThailand"Working with the whole team has been wonderful and being part of the Marketplace community is super fulfilling.”TemplatablesUK“Being able to share templates that people choose time and time again to achieve their goals inspires me to make every design better than the last”.Chattan DesignUK“Selling on the Goodnotes Marketplace has been such a meaningful opportunity. I've been able to share what I love creating, connect with new users, and keep learning as a creator.”.SmollOwlIndonesiaBecoming a marketplace creator1Apply with your product2Applicationapproval3Access our Creator Studio4Upload your product and start earningReady to join us?Share your work with a global audience and get paid for doing what you love!Submit a productFAQsWhat can I sell on Goodnotes Marketplace?You can sell all kinds of digital stationery — planners, templates, stickers, notebooks, covers, and so much more! If it helps someone get organized, makes learning more fun, or sparks creativity in Goodnotes, we'd be thrilled to showcase it on our Marketplace.Can I sell my products on other platforms too?Yes! You're free to sell your digital stationery on other platforms as well. We don’t require exclusivity.What do I need to do to become a creator for Goodnotes Marketplace ?Simply submit your sign-up form, share your beautiful designs with us, and we'll reach out to you for the next steps.What’s the commission structure?You'll earn a commission from each sale of your item. The exact rate will be outlined in your contract during onboarding.Who can list and sell templates on Marketplace?Anyone can created their own digital stationery and apply to sell on Marketplace! Simply submit your work through our sign-up form, and our team will help you get onboard if we find your product a great fit.How and when do I get paid?Creator payments are issued at the end of each quarter via direct bank transfer. You'll receive your total earnings from that quarter after all sales are finalized and processed. Please note that we don't currently offer PayPal payments.Can I sell fonts, handwriting tools, or brushes?Fonts and handwriting tools aren’t currently supported on Marketplace.What makes a product successful on Marketplace?Products with high-quality design, clear organization, practical functionality, and strong visuals (product thumbnail and gallery images) typically perform best. Items that align with seasonal trends or address productivity needs also perform exceptionally well.Will I be able to see live sales data?We currently share your sales data through monthly creator reports, and we are working on building an internal dashboard where you'll be able to see live sales data soon!How long does the onboarding process take?Our team will review applications within 10 business days after submission. Once approved, you'll be invited to sign the commission contract, after which you'll gain access to the Creator Studio where you can begin uploading your items. The entire onboarding process typically takes about 2–3 weeks.

ProductCompare PlansGoodnotes FeaturesGoodnotes AIEducationGoodnotes EducationCase StudiesLearning CenterBusinessMarketplaceWeb MarketplaceApply to be a CreatorHelp & ResourcesGoodnotes Help CenterGoodnotes Education Help CenterGoodnotes for Business Help CenterBlogResearchPressCareersDownloadCandidate Privacy NoticeGoodnotes Limited and its affiliates (the “Company”, “we”, “our” or “us”) are a company with its registered office at 1 Bartholomew Lane, London, United Kingdom, EC2N 2AX. We are committed to protecting and respecting candidate (“Candidate”) privacy. The purpose of this privacy notice (the “Privacy Notice”) is to provide our Candidates with peace of mind by making them aware of the Personal Data (which is defined as any data that identifies or can be used to identify Candidates) we collect directly and from third-parties, how and why Personal Data will be used, how it is secured and how long we retain it. We will only use a Candidate’s Personal Data as set out below and always in accordance with applicable data protection laws.‍1. Data Protection PrinciplesAll processing of Personal Data shall be conducted according to the data protection principles as follows:Personal Data must be processed lawfully, fairly and transparently;Personal Data must be accurate and kept up to date with every effort to erase or correct;Personal Data must be processed in a manner that ensures the appropriate security.2. Candidate RightsUnder certain circumstances, the Candidate may have rights under data protection laws in relation to its Personal Data which the Candidate can exercise free of charge. These rights include:The right to know whether we hold the Candidate’s Personal Data and to request access to its Personal Data held by us.The right to withdraw consent to the processing of its Personal Data at any time. Please note, however, that we may still be entitled to process a Candidate’s Personal Data if we have another legitimate reason for doing so. For example, we may need to retain Personal Data to comply with a legal obligation.The right to request that we rectify Personal Data if it is inaccurate or incomplete.The right to request that we erase Personal Data in certain circumstances. Please note that there may be circumstances where Candidates ask us to erase Personal Data, but we are legally entitled to retain it.In some circumstances, the right to receive the Personal Data provided to us in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and/or to instruct us to transmit that data to a third party.The right to object at any time to its Personal Data being processed for direct marketing and in other certain circumstances, such as if we change our legitimate interests from the basis on which we initially collected and processed the Candidate’s Personal Data.The right to lodge a complaint with the relevant data protection regulator if a Candidate thinks that any of its rights have been infringed by us.If Candidates wish to exercise any of the above rights, or make any related complaint or request in relation to its Personal Data, please contact us by using the contact details below.Further information about Candidate rights may be obtained by contacting the supervisory data protection authority located in the Candidate’s jurisdiction.3. What information do we collect and why?When a Candidate applies for a job or expresses interest for role, we may ask for:a Candidate’s name and contact details (like address, phone number and email address);the type of work the Candidate is looking for;a Candidate’s work and educational history (typically in a Candidate’s CV);the country a Candidate is applying from and the Candidate’s right to work status;Candidate responses to application questions and other information a Candidate gives us through potential take-home tasks;details of a Candidate’s current and/or desired salary and other things relating to compensation and benefits packages;audio, electronic, visual and other data collected when conducting interviews using Third Party Platforms (defined in section 6); anda Candidate’s current notice period.If a Candidate is invited for an interview, we collect:details of any adjustments a Candidate wants us to make for the interview;any other information a Candidate gives us, or observations we make through interviews, that are relevant for a Candidate’s application;a form of identification, proof of address and current and previous addresses, right to work’ checks; anddetails about former managers or colleagues a Candidate wants us to contact as referees.‍Providing this information is optional, but if the Candidate chooses not to, we might not have enough information to consider the Candidate’s  application. We may also ask for the following ‘special category’ data, the Candidate’s provision of which is completely voluntary, and the data will remain anonymous:ethnicitygender identitysexual orientationdisability & neurodiversity status.How we will use and store this data is set out below.4. Data we collect from external sourcesWe may also obtain a Candidate’s contact details and professional profile from:recruitment or executive search agencies; orprofessional networking sites or other public sources such as social media and job boards.In connection with a Candidate’s application and the recruitment process we may also collect:the results of background checks from background checking agencies, this may include (if applicable) information about criminal convictions if a Candidate has a record and a Candidate’s immigration status; andreferences from previous employers, managers or colleagues.5. How we use data during the recruitment processIn accordance with the applicable data protection laws, we only collect data where we have a lawful basis for using Candidate’s Personal Data. Since recruitment is a sensitive matter for both parties we have numerous bases for collecting data:We need to use Personal Data to enter into an employment contract, so we can:Contact the Candidate during the hiring processCarry out background checksConsider the Candidate’s suitability for the role in questionObtain references and vet information that a Candidate has given to us in a CV.We need to use Personal Data to comply with the law, so we can:Make sure a Candidate has the right to work in the jurisdiction the Candidate is applying forRun criminal background checks which are required by law for certain rolesLearn about a Candidate’s fitness and suitability for a Senior Manager Role.We need to use Personal Data when it’s in our ‘legitimate interest’, so we can: Run our recruitment and promotion processes (including our Candidate tracking system)Keep a copy of a Candidate’s application data if the Candidate wants to be considered for other roles. (See ‘Data Retention’ below.)Share Candidate contact details with our travel provider if a Candidate needs to travel to an interview or stay at a hotel.We need a Candidate’s consent to use Candidate data, so we may ask:To obtain a Candidate’s permission to carry out criminal background checks (unless Candidate is being considered for a Senior Manager and/or Non Executive Director role, in which case these checks are mandatory under the law).6. Who May Have Access to Candidate’s DataWe may share a Candidate’s personal data internally within the Company such as with our affiliates, subsidiaries or employees which have a legitimate need to access a Candidate’s personal data and who are subject to duties of confidentiality;We may share Personal Data with Third Party Platforms (which shall mean the software and services used during the recruitment process, these include):Greenhouse - this is our Candidate Tracking System where we store all Personal Data obtained throughout the recruitment process.Google Meet - we use this service to conduct our virtual interviews.Screenloop - we use this service to record our video interviews. The recordings captured by Screenloop are deleted three months after the interview.Recruitment agencies - we will share the outcome of a Candidate’s application so the agency can continue or stop notifying them of alternative opportunities.HackerRank - Candidate responses to the competency test will be processed by HackerRank and supplied to Goodnotes. We will make inferences based on this data that will help us differentiate Candidates with similar profiles.In some limited circumstances, we may be legally required to share certain personal data if relevant to any legal proceedings or to comply with legal obligations, a court order, or the instructions of a government authority.7. Use of Artificial Intelligence in the Hiring ProcessTo enhance the efficiency of our recruitment process, we utilise artificial intelligence (AI) to assist our hiring teams with procedural and preparatory tasks.What the AI Does: Our AI tools help us to extract and categorise information from your CV, such as your skills, qualifications, and employment history, into a standardised format for our recruitment team to review.What the AI Does Not Do: We want to be clear that our AI is not used to make hiring decisions or filter applicants. All assessments of your suitability for a role are carried out by our recruitment team.Human Oversight: The information processed by our AI is always reviewed and verified by a member of our hiring team before any decisions are made regarding your application.The use of AI in this context is based on our legitimate interest to streamline our recruitment process. You have the right to object to this processing. For more information about your rights, please see the "Your Data Protection Rights" section of this notice.8. Data ProtectionWe will use reasonable technical and organisational measures designed to safeguard Personal Data, for example:we encrypt Personal Data;we conduct audits on our Third Party Platforms to ensure they abide with applicable data protection laws and will keep the Personal Data we share with them secure; andany Personal Data that we process or store is done on secure servers.In addition, we have reasonable security measures in place designed to prevent Personal Data from being accidentally or unlawfully lost, used or accessed. We limit access to Candidate Personal Data to those who have a genuine business need to access it. We take steps designed to ensure that those processing Candidate Personal Data will do so only in an authorised manner and are subject to a duty of confidentiality. We also have procedures in place to respond to data security breaches. We will notify Candidates and any applicable regulator of a suspected data security breach where we are legally required to do so.However, since the Internet is not a 100% secure environment, we cannot guarantee, ensure, or warrant the security of any information, including Personal Data, Candidates share with us. There is no guarantee that information, including Personal Data, may not be accessed, disclosed, altered, or destroyed by breach of any of our physical, technical, or managerial safeguards.9. Data RetentionUnless otherwise stipulated, Candidate data will be retained by us for a maximum of twelve (12) months. We keep unsuccessful Candidates’ data for this period so we can notify of alternative roles in which the Candidate may be interested.Candidates may opt out of this at any time.10. Data Protection OfficerGot a question about something in this Privacy Notice, or want to contact our Data Protection Officer (DPO) for recruitment matters? Email Nebahat Arslan legal@goodnotesapp.com .

Join us as a Goodnotes Marketplace CreatorShare your product now and start earning in no time!Submit a productGet discovered by 25 million usersYour digital stationery can reach millions of learners, planners, and creators who actively use Goodnotes every month.Turn your passion into incomeShare what you love — whether it's planners, templates, or study tools, and earn with every download.Ongoing promotion opportunitiesWith monthly campaigns and curated promotions, your products have constant opportunities to be seen, shared, and loved.The real voices from our creator community“Selling here opened up my creative thinking — new trends and fresh customers keep me excited to grow”.The Butter and ScotchThailand"Working with the whole team has been wonderful and being part of the Marketplace community is super fulfilling.”TemplatablesUK“Being able to share templates that people choose time and time again to achieve their goals inspires me to make every design better than the last”.Chattan DesignUK“Selling on the Goodnotes Marketplace has been such a meaningful opportunity. I've been able to share what I love creating, connect with new users, and keep learning as a creator.”.SmollOwlIndonesiaBecoming a marketplace creator1Apply with your product2Applicationapproval3Access our Creator Studio4Upload your product and start earningReady to join us?Share your work with a global audience and get paid for doing what you love!Submit a productFAQsWhat can I sell on Goodnotes Marketplace?You can sell all kinds of digital stationery — planners, templates, stickers, notebooks, covers, and so much more! If it helps someone get organized, makes learning more fun, or sparks creativity in Goodnotes, we'd be thrilled to showcase it on our Marketplace.Can I sell my products on other platforms too?Yes! You're free to sell your digital stationery on other platforms as well. We don’t require exclusivity.What do I need to do to become a creator for Goodnotes Marketplace ?Simply submit your sign-up form, share your beautiful designs with us, and we'll reach out to you for the next steps.What’s the commission structure?You'll earn a commission from each sale of your item. The exact rate will be outlined in your contract during onboarding.Who can list and sell templates on Marketplace?Anyone can created their own digital stationery and apply to sell on Marketplace! Simply submit your work through our sign-up form, and our team will help you get onboard if we find your product a great fit.How and when do I get paid?Creator payments are issued at the end of each quarter via direct bank transfer. You'll receive your total earnings from that quarter after all sales are finalized and processed. Please note that we don't currently offer PayPal payments.Can I sell fonts, handwriting tools, or brushes?Fonts and handwriting tools aren’t currently supported on Marketplace.What makes a product successful on Marketplace?Products with high-quality design, clear organization, practical functionality, and strong visuals (product thumbnail and gallery images) typically perform best. Items that align with seasonal trends or address productivity needs also perform exceptionally well.Will I be able to see live sales data?We currently share your sales data through monthly creator reports, and we are working on building an internal dashboard where you'll be able to see live sales data soon!How long does the onboarding process take?Our team will review applications within 10 business days after submission. Once approved, you'll be invited to sign the commission contract, after which you'll gain access to the Creator Studio where you can begin uploading your items. The entire onboarding process typically takes about 2–3 weeks.

subPages.content: ProductCompare PlansGoodnotes FeaturesGoodnotes AIEducationGoodnotes EducationCase StudiesLearning CenterBusinessMarketplaceWeb MarketplaceApply to be a CreatorHelp & ResourcesGoodnotes Help CenterGoodnotes Education Help CenterGoodnotes for Business Help CenterBlogResearchPressCareersDownloadOur ValuesDream BigAt Goodnotes, we dream big to make a significant impact on learning and unlock full potential. We push boundaries and aim to make a positive impact on society. Our purposeful innovation and commitment to creating a better future drives us to dream bigger every day.Build Great ThingsWe are passionate about excellence. Our curious and ambitious community inspires us to innovate and exceed expectations. We create user-centric products and constantly improve through creativity and iteration. We value quality and impact. Come and join our mission to make a difference in the lives of our users.Operate Like an OwnerWe believe in taking ownership and have a team of exceptional individuals dedicated to making a difference. We encourage everyone to contribute and take responsibility for their roles. Each person's work is valuable and and we value those with an entrepreneurial spirit who lead the way. Together, we work hard to achieve our goals quickly.Win Like a Sports TeamWe believe in teamwork and achieving success together. We collaborate across functions and set aside our egos to focus on the task at hand. GoodPeople support each other and trust in our colleagues to do what's right. Our flat structure and transparent culture foster collaboration and help us achieve our goals.Learn and Grow FastGoodPeople are passionate about unlocking potential in ourselves and our community through continuous learning and growth. We believe in creating an environment that fosters a growth mindset, and as creators, we value taking action and learning through experience. This philosophy is at the core of everything we do, from our products to our processes.Share Our PassionWe are passionate about our work and believe in the power of sharing ideas. We inspire and support each other, striving to maintain excitement and joy in all our endeavours. Our users' passion for Goodnotes fuels us, and we continually innovate and improve the app to demonstrate our commitment to them.Be User ObsessedGoodnotes is committed to putting users at the centre of everything we do. We believe that understanding and addressing user needs is the foundation of creating meaningful, seamless experiences. By actively seeking feedback, analysing data and continuously refining the user journey, we aim to exceed expectations at every touchpoint. With a focus on thoughtful problem-solving and innovation, we strive to deliver solutions that truly resonate with our users and provide lasting value.

subPages.content: ProductCompare PlansGoodnotes FeaturesGoodnotes AIEducationGoodnotes EducationCase StudiesLearning CenterBusinessMarketplaceWeb MarketplaceApply to be a CreatorHelp & ResourcesGoodnotes Help CenterGoodnotes Education Help CenterGoodnotes for Business Help CenterBlogResearchPressCareersDownloadCandidate Privacy NoticeGoodnotes Limited and its affiliates (the “Company”, “we”, “our” or “us”) are a company with its registered office at 1 Bartholomew Lane, London, United Kingdom, EC2N 2AX. We are committed to protecting and respecting candidate (“Candidate”) privacy. The purpose of this privacy notice (the “Privacy Notice”) is to provide our Candidates with peace of mind by making them aware of the Personal Data (which is defined as any data that identifies or can be used to identify Candidates) we collect directly and from third-parties, how and why Personal Data will be used, how it is secured and how long we retain it. We will only use a Candidate’s Personal Data as set out below and always in accordance with applicable data protection laws.‍1. Data Protection PrinciplesAll processing of Personal Data shall be conducted according to the data protection principles as follows:Personal Data must be processed lawfully, fairly and transparently;Personal Data must be accurate and kept up to date with every effort to erase or correct;Personal Data must be processed in a manner that ensures the appropriate security.2. Candidate RightsUnder certain circumstances, the Candidate may have rights under data protection laws in relation to its Personal Data which the Candidate can exercise free of charge. These rights include:The right to know whether we hold the Candidate’s Personal Data and to request access to its Personal Data held by us.The right to withdraw consent to the processing of its Personal Data at any time. Please note, however, that we may still be entitled to process a Candidate’s Personal Data if we have another legitimate reason for doing so. For example, we may need to retain Personal Data to comply with a legal obligation.The right to request that we rectify Personal Data if it is inaccurate or incomplete.The right to request that we erase Personal Data in certain circumstances. Please note that there may be circumstances where Candidates ask us to erase Personal Data, but we are legally entitled to retain it.In some circumstances, the right to receive the Personal Data provided to us in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and/or to instruct us to transmit that data to a third party.The right to object at any time to its Personal Data being processed for direct marketing and in other certain circumstances, such as if we change our legitimate interests from the basis on which we initially collected and processed the Candidate’s Personal Data.The right to lodge a complaint with the relevant data protection regulator if a Candidate thinks that any of its rights have been infringed by us.If Candidates wish to exercise any of the above rights, or make any related complaint or request in relation to its Personal Data, please contact us by using the contact details below.Further information about Candidate rights may be obtained by contacting the supervisory data protection authority located in the Candidate’s jurisdiction.3. What information do we collect and why?When a Candidate applies for a job or expresses interest for role, we may ask for:a Candidate’s name and contact details (like address, phone number and email address);the type of work the Candidate is looking for;a Candidate’s work and educational history (typically in a Candidate’s CV);the country a Candidate is applying from and the Candidate’s right to work status;Candidate responses to application questions and other information a Candidate gives us through potential take-home tasks;details of a Candidate’s current and/or desired salary and other things relating to compensation and benefits packages;audio, electronic, visual and other data collected when conducting interviews using Third Party Platforms (defined in section 6); anda Candidate’s current notice period.If a Candidate is invited for an interview, we collect:details of any adjustments a Candidate wants us to make for the interview;any other information a Candidate gives us, or observations we make through interviews, that are relevant for a Candidate’s application;a form of identification, proof of address and current and previous addresses, right to work’ checks; anddetails about former managers or colleagues a Candidate wants us to contact as referees.‍Providing this information is optional, but if the Candidate chooses not to, we might not have enough information to consider the Candidate’s  application. We may also ask for the following ‘special category’ data, the Candidate’s provision of which is completely voluntary, and the data will remain anonymous:ethnicitygender identitysexual orientationdisability & neurodiversity status.How we will use and store this data is set out below.4. Data we collect from external sourcesWe may also obtain a Candidate’s contact details and professional profile from:recruitment or executive search agencies; orprofessional networking sites or other public sources such as social media and job boards.In connection with a Candidate’s application and the recruitment process we may also collect:the results of background checks from background checking agencies, this may include (if applicable) information about criminal convictions if a Candidate has a record and a Candidate’s immigration status; andreferences from previous employers, managers or colleagues.5. How we use data during the recruitment processIn accordance with the applicable data protection laws, we only collect data where we have a lawful basis for using Candidate’s Personal Data. Since recruitment is a sensitive matter for both parties we have numerous bases for collecting data:We need to use Personal Data to enter into an employment contract, so we can:Contact the Candidate during the hiring processCarry out background checksConsider the Candidate’s suitability for the role in questionObtain references and vet information that a Candidate has given to us in a CV.We need to use Personal Data to comply with the law, so we can:Make sure a Candidate has the right to work in the jurisdiction the Candidate is applying forRun criminal background checks which are required by law for certain rolesLearn about a Candidate’s fitness and suitability for a Senior Manager Role.We need to use Personal Data when it’s in our ‘legitimate interest’, so we can: Run our recruitment and promotion processes (including our Candidate tracking system)Keep a copy of a Candidate’s application data if the Candidate wants to be considered for other roles. (See ‘Data Retention’ below.)Share Candidate contact details with our travel provider if a Candidate needs to travel to an interview or stay at a hotel.We need a Candidate’s consent to use Candidate data, so we may ask:To obtain a Candidate’s permission to carry out criminal background checks (unless Candidate is being considered for a Senior Manager and/or Non Executive Director role, in which case these checks are mandatory under the law).6. Who May Have Access to Candidate’s DataWe may share a Candidate’s personal data internally within the Company such as with our affiliates, subsidiaries or employees which have a legitimate need to access a Candidate’s personal data and who are subject to duties of confidentiality;We may share Personal Data with Third Party Platforms (which shall mean the software and services used during the recruitment process, these include):Greenhouse - this is our Candidate Tracking System where we store all Personal Data obtained throughout the recruitment process.Google Meet - we use this service to conduct our virtual interviews.Screenloop - we use this service to record our video interviews. The recordings captured by Screenloop are deleted three months after the interview.Recruitment agencies - we will share the outcome of a Candidate’s application so the agency can continue or stop notifying them of alternative opportunities.HackerRank - Candidate responses to the competency test will be processed by HackerRank and supplied to Goodnotes. We will make inferences based on this data that will help us differentiate Candidates with similar profiles.In some limited circumstances, we may be legally required to share certain personal data if relevant to any legal proceedings or to comply with legal obligations, a court order, or the instructions of a government authority.7. Use of Artificial Intelligence in the Hiring ProcessTo enhance the efficiency of our recruitment process, we utilise artificial intelligence (AI) to assist our hiring teams with procedural and preparatory tasks.What the AI Does: Our AI tools help us to extract and categorise information from your CV, such as your skills, qualifications, and employment history, into a standardised format for our recruitment team to review.What the AI Does Not Do: We want to be clear that our AI is not used to make hiring decisions or filter applicants. All assessments of your suitability for a role are carried out by our recruitment team.Human Oversight: The information processed by our AI is always reviewed and verified by a member of our hiring team before any decisions are made regarding your application.The use of AI in this context is based on our legitimate interest to streamline our recruitment process. You have the right to object to this processing. For more information about your rights, please see the "Your Data Protection Rights" section of this notice.8. Data ProtectionWe will use reasonable technical and organisational measures designed to safeguard Personal Data, for example:we encrypt Personal Data;we conduct audits on our Third Party Platforms to ensure they abide with applicable data protection laws and will keep the Personal Data we share with them secure; andany Personal Data that we process or store is done on secure servers.In addition, we have reasonable security measures in place designed to prevent Personal Data from being accidentally or unlawfully lost, used or accessed. We limit access to Candidate Personal Data to those who have a genuine business need to access it. We take steps designed to ensure that those processing Candidate Personal Data will do so only in an authorised manner and are subject to a duty of confidentiality. We also have procedures in place to respond to data security breaches. We will notify Candidates and any applicable regulator of a suspected data security breach where we are legally required to do so.However, since the Internet is not a 100% secure environment, we cannot guarantee, ensure, or warrant the security of any information, including Personal Data, Candidates share with us. There is no guarantee that information, including Personal Data, may not be accessed, disclosed, altered, or destroyed by breach of any of our physical, technical, or managerial safeguards.9. Data RetentionUnless otherwise stipulated, Candidate data will be retained by us for a maximum of twelve (12) months. We keep unsuccessful Candidates’ data for this period so we can notify of alternative roles in which the Candidate may be interested.Candidates may opt out of this at any time.10. Data Protection OfficerGot a question about something in this Privacy Notice, or want to contact our Data Protection Officer (DPO) for recruitment matters? Email Nebahat Arslan legal@goodnotesapp.com .
